blank: thumm ʾantum hāʾulāʾ taqtulūn ʾanfusakum w-tukhrijūn farīqam-minkum m diyārihim taẓāharūn ʿalayhim b-l-ʾithm w-l-ʿudwān w-ʾ yaʾtūkum ʾusārā tufādūhum w-huw muḥarram ʿalaykum ʾikhrājuhum ʾ-f-tuʾminūn b-baʿḍil-kitāb w-takfurūn b-baʿḍ f-mā jazāʾ m yafʿal dhālik minkum ʾillā khizy fīl-ḥayāt d-dunyā w-yawmal-qiyāmat yuraddūn ʾilā ʾashaddil-ʿadhāb w-mā llāh b-ghāfil ʿammā taʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: Then, you are those same ones who are killing one another and evicting a party of your people from their homes, cooperating against them in sin and aggression. And if they come to you as captives, you ransom them, although their eviction was forbidden to you. So do you believe in part of the Scripture and disbelieve in part? Then what is the recompense for those who do that among you except disgrace in worldly life; and on the Day of Resurrection they will be sent back to the severest of punishment. And Allah is not unaware of what you do

arabic_uthmani: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ اشتَرَوُا الحَياةَ الدُّنيا بِالآخِرَةِ ۖ فَلا يُخَفَّفُ عَنهُمُ العَذابُ وَلا هُم يُنصَرونَ
blank: ʾulāʾikalladhīn shtarawul-ḥayāt d-dunyā b-l-ʾākhirat f-lā yukhaffaf ʿanhumul-ʿadhāb w-lā hum yunṣarūn
english_saheeh_international: Those are the ones who have bought the life of this world in exchange for the Hereafter, so the punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be aided

arabic_uthmani: وَلَقَد آتَينا موسَى الكِتابَ وَقَفَّينا مِن بَعدِهِ بِالرُّسُلِ ۖ وَآتَينا عيسَى ابنَ مَريَمَ البَيِّناتِ وَأَيَّدناهُ بِروحِ القُدُسِ ۗ أَفَكُلَّما جاءَكُم رَسولٌ بِما لا تَهوىٰ أَنفُسُكُمُ استَكبَرتُم فَفَريقًا كَذَّبتُم وَفَريقًا تَقتُلونَ
blank: w-l-qad ʾātaynā mūsāl-kitāb w-qaffaynā m baʿdihī b-r-rusul w-ʾātaynā ʿīsā bn maryamal-bayyināt w-ʾayyadnāh b-rūḥil-qudus ʾ-f-kullamā jāʾakum rasūl b-mā lā tahwā ʾanfusukum stakbartum f-farīq kadhdhabtum w-farīq taqtulūn
english_saheeh_international: And We did certainly give Moses the Torah and followed up after him with messengers. And We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, clear proofs and supported him with the Pure Spirit. But is it not that every time a messenger came to you, O Children of Israel, with what your souls did not desire, you were arrogant? And a party of messengers you denied and another party you killed

arabic_uthmani: وَقالوا قُلوبُنا غُلفٌ ۚ بَل لَعَنَهُمُ اللَّهُ بِكُفرِهِم فَقَليلًا ما يُؤمِنونَ
blank: w-qālū qulūbunā ghulf bal laʿanahum llāh b-kufrihim f-qalīlam-mā yuʾminūn
english_saheeh_international: And they said, "Our hearts are wrapped." But, in fact, Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so little is it that they believe

arabic_uthmani: وَلَمّا جاءَهُم كِتابٌ مِن عِندِ اللَّهِ مُصَدِّقٌ لِما مَعَهُم وَكانوا مِن قَبلُ يَستَفتِحونَ عَلَى الَّذينَ كَفَروا فَلَمّا جاءَهُم ما عَرَفوا كَفَروا بِهِ ۚ فَلَعنَةُ اللَّهِ عَلَى الكافِرينَ
blank: w-lammā jāʾahum kitāb m ʿind llāh muṣaddiq l-mā maʿahum w-kānū m qabl yastaftiḥūn ʿalālladhīn kafarū f-lammā jāʾahum mā ʿarafū kafarū bihī f-laʿnat llāh ʿalāl-kāfirīn
english_saheeh_international: And when there came to them a Book from Allah confirming that which was with them - although before they used to pray for victory against those who disbelieved - but then when there came to them that which they recognized, they disbelieved in it; so the curse of Allah will be upon the disbelievers

arabic_uthmani: بِئسَمَا اشتَرَوا بِهِ أَنفُسَهُم أَن يَكفُروا بِما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ بَغيًا أَن يُنَزِّلَ اللَّهُ مِن فَضلِهِ عَلىٰ مَن يَشاءُ مِن عِبادِهِ ۖ فَباءوا بِغَضَبٍ عَلىٰ غَضَبٍ ۚ وَلِلكافِرينَ عَذابٌ مُهينٌ
blank: biʾsamā shtaraw bihī ʾanfusahum ʾ yakfurū b-mā ʾanzal llāh baghy ʾ yunazzil llāh m faḍlihī ʿalā m yashāʾ m ʿibādihī f-bāʾū b-ghaḍab ʿalā ghaḍab w-l-l-kāfirīn ʿadhāb muhīn
english_saheeh_international: How wretched is that for which they sold themselves - that they would disbelieve in what Allah has revealed through their outrage that Allah would send down His favor upon whom He wills from among His servants. So they returned having earned wrath upon wrath. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُم آمِنوا بِما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ قالوا نُؤمِنُ بِما أُنزِلَ عَلَينا وَيَكفُرونَ بِما وَراءَهُ وَهُوَ الحَقُّ مُصَدِّقًا لِما مَعَهُم ۗ قُل فَلِمَ تَقتُلونَ أَنبِياءَ اللَّهِ مِن قَبلُ إِن كُنتُم مُؤمِنينَ
blank: w-ʾidhā qīl lahum ʾāminū b-mā ʾanzal llāh qālū nuʾmin b-mā ʾunzil ʿalaynā w-yakfurūn b-mā warāʾahū w-huwal-ḥaqq muṣaddiq l-mā maʿahum qul f-l-m taqtulūn ʾanbiyāʾ llāh m qabl ʾ kuntum muʾminīn
english_saheeh_international: And when it is said to them, "Believe in what Allah has revealed," they say, "We believe only in what was revealed to us." And they disbelieve in what came after it, while it is the truth confirming that which is with them. Say, "Then why did you kill the prophets of Allah before, if you are indeed believers

arabic_uthmani: ۞ وَلَقَد جاءَكُم موسىٰ بِالبَيِّناتِ ثُمَّ اتَّخَذتُمُ العِجلَ مِن بَعدِهِ وَأَنتُم ظالِمونَ
blank: w-l-qad jāʾakum mūsā b-l-bayyināt thumm ttakhadhtumul-ʿijl m baʿdihī w-ʾantum ẓālimūn
english_saheeh_international: And Moses had certainly brought you clear proofs. Then you took the calf in worship after that, while you were wrongdoers

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذ أَخَذنا ميثاقَكُم وَرَفَعنا فَوقَكُمُ الطّورَ خُذوا ما آتَيناكُم بِقُوَّةٍ وَاسمَعوا ۖ قالوا سَمِعنا وَعَصَينا وَأُشرِبوا في قُلوبِهِمُ العِجلَ بِكُفرِهِم ۚ قُل بِئسَما يَأمُرُكُم بِهِ إيمانُكُم إِن كُنتُم مُؤمِنينَ
blank: w-ʾidh ʾakhadhnā mīthāqakum w-rafaʿnā fawqakum ṭ-ṭūr khudhū mā ʾātaynākum b-quwwat w-smaʿū qālū samiʿnā w-ʿaṣaynā w-ʾushribū fī qulūbihimul-ʿijl b-kufrihim qul biʾs-mā yaʾmurukum bihī ʾīmānukum ʾ kuntum muʾminīn
english_saheeh_international: And recall when We took your covenant and raised over you the mount, saying, "Take what We have given you with determination and listen." They said instead, "We hear and disobey." And their hearts absorbed the worship of the calf because of their disbelief. Say, "How wretched is that which your faith enjoins upon you, if you should be believers

arabic_uthmani: قُل إِن كانَت لَكُمُ الدّارُ الآخِرَةُ عِندَ اللَّهِ خالِصَةً مِن دونِ النّاسِ فَتَمَنَّوُا المَوتَ إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
blank: qul ʾ kānat lakum d-dārul-ʾākhirat ʿind llāh khāliṣatam-m dūn n-nās f-tamannawul-mawt ʾ kuntum ṣādiqīn
english_saheeh_international: Say, O Muhammad, "If the home of the Hereafter with Allah is for you alone and not the other people, then wish for death, if you should be truthful

arabic_uthmani: وَلَن يَتَمَنَّوهُ أَبَدًا بِما قَدَّمَت أَيديهِم ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَليمٌ بِالظّالِمينَ
blank: w-l yatamannawh ʾabad b-mā qaddamat ʾaydīhim w-llāh ʿalīm b-ẓ-ẓālimīn
english_saheeh_international: But they will never wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have put forth. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers

arabic_uthmani: وَلَتَجِدَنَّهُم أَحرَصَ النّاسِ عَلىٰ حَياةٍ وَمِنَ الَّذينَ أَشرَكوا ۚ يَوَدُّ أَحَدُهُم لَو يُعَمَّرُ أَلفَ سَنَةٍ وَما هُوَ بِمُزَحزِحِهِ مِنَ العَذابِ أَن يُعَمَّرَ ۗ وَاللَّهُ بَصيرٌ بِما يَعمَلونَ
blank: w-l-tajidannahum ʾaḥraṣ n-nās ʿalā ḥayāt w-minalladhīn ʾashrakū yawadd ʾaḥaduhum law yuʿammar ʾalf sanat w-mā huw b-muzaḥziḥihī minal-ʿadhāb ʾ yuʿammar w-llāh baṣīr b-mā yaʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: And you will surely find them the most greedy of people for life - even more than those who associate others with Allah. One of them wishes that he could be granted life a thousand years, but it would not remove him in the least from the coming punishment that he should be granted life. And Allah is Seeing of what they do

arabic_uthmani: قُل مَن كانَ عَدُوًّا لِجِبريلَ فَإِنَّهُ نَزَّلَهُ عَلىٰ قَلبِكَ بِإِذنِ اللَّهِ مُصَدِّقًا لِما بَينَ يَدَيهِ وَهُدًى وَبُشرىٰ لِلمُؤمِنينَ
blank: qul m kān ʿaduww l-jibrīl f-ʾinnahū nazzalahū ʿalā qalbik b-ʾidhn llāh muṣaddiq l-mā bayn yadayh w-hud w-bushrā l-l-muʾminīn
english_saheeh_international: Say, "Whoever is an enemy to Gabriel - it is none but he who has brought the Qur'an down upon your heart, O Muhammad, by permission of Allah, confirming that which was before it and as guidance and good tidings for the believers

arabic_uthmani: مَن كانَ عَدُوًّا لِلَّهِ وَمَلائِكَتِهِ وَرُسُلِهِ وَجِبريلَ وَميكالَ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ عَدُوٌّ لِلكافِرينَ
blank: m kān ʿaduww l-llāh w-malāʾikatihī w-rusulihī w-jibrīl w-mīkāl f-ʾinn llāh ʿaduww l-l-kāfirīn
english_saheeh_international: Whoever is an enemy to Allah and His angels and His messengers and Gabriel and Michael - then indeed, Allah is an enemy to the disbelievers

arabic_uthmani: وَلَقَد أَنزَلنا إِلَيكَ آياتٍ بَيِّناتٍ ۖ وَما يَكفُرُ بِها إِلَّا الفاسِقونَ
blank: w-l-qad ʾanzalnā ʾilayk ʾāyāt bayyināt w-mā yakfur bihā ʾillāl-fāsiqūn
english_saheeh_international: And We have certainly revealed to you verses which are clear proofs, and no one would deny them except the defiantly disobedient

arabic_uthmani: أَوكُلَّما عاهَدوا عَهدًا نَبَذَهُ فَريقٌ مِنهُم ۚ بَل أَكثَرُهُم لا يُؤمِنونَ
blank: ʾ-w-kullamā ʿāhadū ʿahd nabadhahū farīq minhum bal ʾaktharuhum lā yuʾminūn
english_saheeh_international: Is it not true that every time they took a covenant a party of them threw it away? But, in fact, most of them do not believe

arabic_uthmani: وَلَمّا جاءَهُم رَسولٌ مِن عِندِ اللَّهِ مُصَدِّقٌ لِما مَعَهُم نَبَذَ فَريقٌ مِنَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا الكِتابَ كِتابَ اللَّهِ وَراءَ ظُهورِهِم كَأَنَّهُم لا يَعلَمونَ
blank: w-lammā jāʾahum rasūl m ʿind llāh muṣaddiq l-mā maʿahum nabadh farīq minalladhīn ʾūtūl-kitāb kitāb llāh warāʾ ẓuhūrihim k-ʾannahum lā yaʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: And when a messenger from Allah came to them confirming that which was with them, a party of those who had been given the Scripture threw the Scripture of Allah behind their backs as if they did not know what it contained

arabic_uthmani: وَاتَّبَعوا ما تَتلُو الشَّياطينُ عَلىٰ مُلكِ سُلَيمانَ ۖ وَما كَفَرَ سُلَيمانُ وَلٰكِنَّ الشَّياطينَ كَفَرَوا يُعَلِّمونَ النّاسَ السِّحرَ وَما أُنزِلَ عَلَى المَلَكَينِ بِبابِلاً هاروتَ وَماروتَ ۚ وَما يُعَلِّمانِ مِن أَحَدٍ حَتّىٰ يَقولا إِنَّما نَحنُ فِتنَةٌ فَلا تَكفُر ۖ فَيَتَعَلَّمونَ مِنهُما ما يُفَرِّقونَ بِهِ بَينَ المَرءِ وَزَوجِهِ ۚ وَما هُم بِضارّينَ بِهِ مِن أَحَدٍ إِلّا بِإِذنِ اللَّهِ ۚ وَيَتَعَلَّمونَ ما يَضُرُّهُم وَلا يَنفَعُهُم ۚ وَلَقَد عَلِموا لَمَنِ اشتَراهُ ما لَهُ فِي الآخِرَةِ مِن خَلاقٍ ۚ وَلَبِئسَ ما شَرَوا بِهِ أَنفُسَهُم ۚ لَو كانوا يَعلَمونَ
blank: w-ttabaʿū mā tatlū sh-shayāṭīn ʿalā mulk sulaymān w-mā kafar sulaymān w-lākinn sh-shayāṭīn kafarū yuʿallimūn n-nās s-siḥr w-mā ʾunzil ʿalāl-malakayn b-bābil hārūt w-mārūt w-mā yuʿallimān m ʾaḥad ḥattā yaqūlā ʾinnamā naḥn fitnat f-lā takfur f-yataʿallamūn minhumā mā yufarriqūn bihī baynal-marʾ w-zawjihī w-mā hum b-ḍārrīn bihī m ʾaḥad ʾillā b-ʾidhn llāh w-yataʿallamūn mā yaḍurruhum w-lā yanfaʿuhum w-l-qad ʿalimū l-man shtarāh mā lahū fīl-ʾākhirat m khalāq w-l-biʾs mā sharaw bihī ʾanfusahum law kānū yaʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: And they followed instead what the devils had recited during the reign of Solomon. It was not Solomon who disbelieved, but the devils disbelieved, teaching people magic and that which was revealed to the two angels at Babylon, Harut and Marut. But the two angels do not teach anyone unless they say, "We are a trial, so do not disbelieve by practicing magic." And yet they learn from them that by which they cause separation between a man and his wife. But they do not harm anyone through it except by permission of Allah. And the people learn what harms them and does not benefit them. But the Children of Israel certainly knew that whoever purchased the magic would not have in the Hereafter any share. And wretched is that for which they sold themselves, if they only knew

arabic_uthmani: وَلَو أَنَّهُم آمَنوا وَاتَّقَوا لَمَثوبَةٌ مِن عِندِ اللَّهِ خَيرٌ ۖ لَو كانوا يَعلَمونَ
blank: w-law ʾannahum ʾāmanū w-ttaqaw l-mathūbat m ʿind llāh khayr law kānū yaʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: And if they had believed and feared Allah, then the reward from Allah would have been far better, if they only knew

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا لا تَقولوا راعِنا وَقولُوا انظُرنا وَاسمَعوا ۗ وَلِلكافِرينَ عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū lā taqūlū rāʿinā w-qūlū nẓurnā w-smaʿū w-l-l-kāfirīn ʿadhāb ʾalīm
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, say not to Allah 's Messenger, "Ra'ina" but say, "Unthurna" and listen. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment

arabic_uthmani: ما يَوَدُّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا مِن أَهلِ الكِتابِ وَلَا المُشرِكينَ أَن يُنَزَّلَ عَلَيكُم مِن خَيرٍ مِن رَبِّكُم ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَختَصُّ بِرَحمَتِهِ مَن يَشاءُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ ذُو الفَضلِ العَظيمِ
blank: mā yawaddulladhīn kafarū m ʾahlil-kitāb w-lāl-mushrikīn ʾ yunazzal ʿalaykum m khayr m rabbikum w-llāh yakhtaṣṣ b-raḥmatihī m yashāʾ w-llāh dhūl-faḍlil-ʿaẓīm
english_saheeh_international: Neither those who disbelieve from the People of the Scripture nor the polytheists wish that any good should be sent down to you from your Lord. But Allah selects for His mercy whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty

arabic_uthmani: ۞ ما نَنسَخ مِن آيَةٍ أَو نُنسِها نَأتِ بِخَيرٍ مِنها أَو مِثلِها ۗ أَلَم تَعلَم أَنَّ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
blank: mā nansakh m ʾāyat ʾaw nunsihā naʾt b-khayr minhā ʾaw mithlihā ʾ-lam taʿlam ʾann llāh ʿalā kull shayʾ qadīr
english_saheeh_international: We do not abrogate a verse or cause it to be forgotten except that We bring forth one better than it or similar to it. Do you not know that Allah is over all things competent

arabic_uthmani: أَلَم تَعلَم أَنَّ اللَّهَ لَهُ مُلكُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۗ وَما لَكُم مِن دونِ اللَّهِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلا نَصيرٍ
blank: ʾ-lam taʿlam ʾann llāh lahū mulk s-samāwāt w-l-ʾارḍ w-mā lakum m dūn llāh m waliyy w-lā naṣīr
english_saheeh_international: Do you not know that to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and that you have not besides Allah any protector or any helper

arabic_uthmani: أَم تُريدونَ أَن تَسأَلوا رَسولَكُم كَما سُئِلَ موسىٰ مِن قَبلُ ۗ وَمَن يَتَبَدَّلِ الكُفرَ بِالإيمانِ فَقَد ضَلَّ سَواءَ السَّبيلِ
blank: ʾam turīdūn ʾ tasʾalū rasūlakum k-mā suʾil mūsā m qabl w-m yatabaddalil-kufr b-l-ʾīmān f-qad ḍall sawāʾ s-sabīl
english_saheeh_international: Or do you intend to ask your Messenger as Moses was asked before? And whoever exchanges faith for disbelief has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way

arabic_uthmani: وَدَّ كَثيرٌ مِن أَهلِ الكِتابِ لَو يَرُدّونَكُم مِن بَعدِ إيمانِكُم كُفّارًا حَسَدًا مِن عِندِ أَنفُسِهِم مِن بَعدِ ما تَبَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الحَقُّ ۖ فَاعفوا وَاصفَحوا حَتّىٰ يَأتِيَ اللَّهُ بِأَمرِهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
blank: wadd kathīr m ʾahlil-kitāb law yaruddūnakum m baʿd ʾīmānikum kuffār ḥasadam-m ʿind ʾanfusihim m baʿd mā tabayyan lahumul-ḥaqq f-ʿfū w-ṣfaḥū ḥattā yaʾtiy llāh b-ʾamrihī ʾinn llāh ʿalā kull shayʾ qadīr
english_saheeh_international: Many of the People of the Scripture wish they could turn you back to disbelief after you have believed, out of envy from themselves even after the truth has become clear to them. So pardon and overlook until Allah delivers His command. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent

arabic_uthmani: وَأَقيمُوا الصَّلاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكاةَ ۚ وَما تُقَدِّموا لِأَنفُسِكُم مِن خَيرٍ تَجِدوهُ عِندَ اللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بِما تَعمَلونَ بَصيرٌ
blank: w-ʾaqīmū ṣ-ṣalāt w-ʾātū z-zakāt w-mā tuqaddimū l-ʾanfusikum m khayr tajidūh ʿind llāh ʾinn llāh b-mā taʿmalūn baṣīr
english_saheeh_international: And establish prayer and give zakah, and whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allah. Indeed, Allah of what you do, is Seeing

arabic_uthmani: وَقالوا لَن يَدخُلَ الجَنَّةَ إِلّا مَن كانَ هودًا أَو نَصارىٰ ۗ تِلكَ أَمانِيُّهُم ۗ قُل هاتوا بُرهانَكُم إِن كُنتُم صادِقينَ
blank: w-qālū l yadkhulal-jannat ʾillā m kān hūd ʾaw naṣārā tilk ʾamāniyyuhum qul hātū burhānakum ʾ kuntum ṣādiqīn
english_saheeh_international: And they say, "None will enter Paradise except one who is a Jew or a Christian." That is merely their wishful thinking, Say, "Produce your proof, if you should be truthful

arabic_uthmani: بَلىٰ مَن أَسلَمَ وَجهَهُ لِلَّهِ وَهُوَ مُحسِنٌ فَلَهُ أَجرُهُ عِندَ رَبِّهِ وَلا خَوفٌ عَلَيهِم وَلا هُم يَحزَنونَ
blank: balā m ʾaslam wajhahū l-llāh w-huw muḥsin f-lahū ʾajruhū ʿind rabbihī w-lā khawf ʿalayhim w-lā hum yaḥzanūn
english_saheeh_international: Yes on the contrary, whoever submits his face in Islam to Allah while being a doer of good will have his reward with his Lord. And no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve

arabic_uthmani: وَقالَتِ اليَهودُ لَيسَتِ النَّصارىٰ عَلىٰ شَيءٍ وَقالَتِ النَّصارىٰ لَيسَتِ اليَهودُ عَلىٰ شَيءٍ وَهُم يَتلونَ الكِتابَ ۗ كَذٰلِكَ قالَ الَّذينَ لا يَعلَمونَ مِثلَ قَولِهِم ۚ فَاللَّهُ يَحكُمُ بَينَهُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ فيما كانوا فيهِ يَختَلِفونَ
blank: w-qālatil-yahūd laysat n-naṣārā ʿalā shayʾ w-qālat n-naṣārā laysatil-yahūd ʿalā shayʾ w-hum yatlūnal-kitāb k-dhālik qālalladhīn lā yaʿlamūn mithl qawlihim f-llāh yaḥkum baynahum yawmal-qiyāmat fī-mā kānū fīh yakhtalifūn
english_saheeh_international: The Jews say "The Christians have nothing true to stand on," and the Christians say, "The Jews have nothing to stand on," although they both recite the Scripture. Thus the polytheists speak the same as their words. But Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ

arabic_uthmani: وَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّن مَنَعَ مَساجِدَ اللَّهِ أَن يُذكَرَ فيهَا اسمُهُ وَسَعىٰ في خَرابِها ۚ أُولٰئِكَ ما كانَ لَهُم أَن يَدخُلوها إِلّا خائِفينَ ۚ لَهُم فِي الدُّنيا خِزيٌ وَلَهُم فِي الآخِرَةِ عَذابٌ عَظيمٌ
blank: w-m ʾaẓlam mimmam-manaʿ masājid llāh ʾ yudhkar fīhā smuhū w-saʿā fī kharābihā ʾulāʾik mā kān lahum ʾ yadkhulūhā ʾillā khāʾifīn lahum fī d-dunyā khizy w-lahum fīl-ʾākhirat ʿadhāb ʿaẓīm
english_saheeh_international: And who are more unjust than those who prevent the name of Allah from being mentioned in His mosques and strive toward their destruction. It is not for them to enter them except in fear. For them in this world is disgrace, and they will have in the Hereafter a great punishment

arabic_uthmani: وَلِلَّهِ المَشرِقُ وَالمَغرِبُ ۚ فَأَينَما تُوَلّوا فَثَمَّ وَجهُ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ واسِعٌ عَليمٌ
blank: w-l-llāhil-mashriq w-l-maghrib f-ʾaynamā tuwallū f-thamm wajh llāh ʾinn llāh wāsiʿ ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: And to Allah belongs the east and the west. So wherever you might turn, there is the Face of Allah. Indeed, Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing

arabic_uthmani: وَقالُوا اتَّخَذَ اللَّهُ وَلَدًا ۗ سُبحانَهُ ۖ بَل لَهُ ما فِي السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ كُلٌّ لَهُ قانِتونَ
blank: w-qālū ttakhadh llāh walad subḥānahū bal lahū mā fī s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ kull lahū qānitūn
english_saheeh_international: They say, "Allah has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. All are devoutly obedient to Him

arabic_uthmani: بَديعُ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ ۖ وَإِذا قَضىٰ أَمرًا فَإِنَّما يَقولُ لَهُ كُن فَيَكونُ
blank: badīʿ s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ w-ʾidhā qaḍā ʾamr f-ʾinnamā yaqūl lahū k f-yakūn
english_saheeh_international: Originator of the heavens and the earth. When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, "Be," and it is

arabic_uthmani: وَقالَ الَّذينَ لا يَعلَمونَ لَولا يُكَلِّمُنَا اللَّهُ أَو تَأتينا آيَةٌ ۗ كَذٰلِكَ قالَ الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِهِم مِثلَ قَولِهِم ۘ تَشابَهَت قُلوبُهُم ۗ قَد بَيَّنَّا الآياتِ لِقَومٍ يوقِنونَ
blank: w-qālalladhīn lā yaʿlamūn law-lā yukallimunā llāh ʾaw taʾtīnā ʾāyat k-dhālik qālalladhīn m qablihim mithl qawlihim tashābahat qulūbuhum qad bayyannāl-ʾāyāt l-qawm yūqinūn
english_saheeh_international: Those who do not know say, "Why does Allah not speak to us or there come to us a sign?" Thus spoke those before them like their words. Their hearts resemble each other. We have shown clearly the signs to a people who are certain in faith

arabic_uthmani: إِنّا أَرسَلناكَ بِالحَقِّ بَشيرًا وَنَذيرًا ۖ وَلا تُسأَلُ عَن أَصحابِ الجَحيمِ
blank: ʾinnā ʾarsalnāk b-l-ḥaqq bashīr w-nadhīr w-lā tusʾal ʿ ʾaṣḥābil-jaḥīm
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, We have sent you, O Muhammad, with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner, and you will not be asked about the companions of Hellfire

arabic_uthmani: وَلَن تَرضىٰ عَنكَ اليَهودُ وَلَا النَّصارىٰ حَتّىٰ تَتَّبِعَ مِلَّتَهُم ۗ قُل إِنَّ هُدَى اللَّهِ هُوَ الهُدىٰ ۗ وَلَئِنِ اتَّبَعتَ أَهواءَهُم بَعدَ الَّذي جاءَكَ مِنَ العِلمِ ۙ ما لَكَ مِنَ اللَّهِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلا نَصيرٍ
blank: w-l tarḍā ʿankal-yahūd w-lā n-naṣārā ḥattā tattabiʿ millatahum qul ʾinn hudā llāh huwal-hudā w-l-ʾin ttabaʿt ʾahwāʾahum baʿdalladhī jāʾak minal-ʿilm mā lak min llāh m waliyy w-lā naṣīr
english_saheeh_international: And never will the Jews or the Christians approve of you until you follow their religion. Say, "Indeed, the guidance of Allah is the only guidance." If you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, you would have against Allah no protector or helper

arabic_uthmani: الَّذينَ آتَيناهُمُ الكِتابَ يَعرِفونَهُ كَما يَعرِفونَ أَبناءَهُم ۖ وَإِنَّ فَريقًا مِنهُم لَيَكتُمونَ الحَقَّ وَهُم يَعلَمونَ
blank: alladhīn ʾātaynāhumul-kitāb yaʿrifūnahū k-mā yaʿrifūn ʾabnāʾahum w-ʾinn farīqam-minhum l-yaktumūnal-ḥaqq w-hum yaʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: Those to whom We gave the Scripture know him as they know their own sons. But indeed, a party of them conceal the truth while they know it

arabic_uthmani: يا بَني إِسرائيلَ اذكُروا نِعمَتِيَ الَّتي أَنعَمتُ عَلَيكُم وَأَنّي فَضَّلتُكُم عَلَى العالَمينَ
blank: yā-banī ʾisrāʾīl dhkurū niʿmatiy llatī ʾanʿamt ʿalaykum w-ʾannī faḍḍaltukum ʿalāl-ʿālamīn
english_saheeh_international: O Children of Israel, remember My favor which I have bestowed upon you and that I preferred you over the worlds

arabic_uthmani: وَاتَّقوا يَومًا لا تَجزي نَفسٌ عَن نَفسٍ شَيئًا وَلا يُقبَلُ مِنها عَدلٌ وَلا تَنفَعُها شَفاعَةٌ وَلا هُم يُنصَرونَ
blank: w-ttaqū yawm lā tajzī nafs ʿ nafs shayʾ w-lā yuqbal minhā ʿadl w-lā tanfaʿuhā shafāʿat w-lā hum yunṣarūn
english_saheeh_international: And fear a Day when no soul will suffice for another soul at all, and no compensation will be accepted from it, nor will any intercession benefit it, nor will they be aided

arabic_uthmani: ۞ وَإِذِ ابتَلىٰ إِبراهيمَ رَبُّهُ بِكَلِماتٍ فَأَتَمَّهُنَّ ۖ قالَ إِنّي جاعِلُكَ لِلنّاسِ إِمامًا ۖ قالَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتي ۖ قالَ لا يَنالُ عَهدِي الظّالِمينَ
blank: w-ʾidh btalā ʾibrāhīm rabbuhū b-kalimāt f-ʾatammahunn qāl ʾinnī jāʿiluk l-n-nās ʾimām qāl w-m dhurriyyatī qāl lā yanāl ʿahdī ẓ-ẓālimīn
english_saheeh_international: And mention, O Muhammad, when Abraham was tried by his Lord with commands and he fulfilled them. Allah said, "Indeed, I will make you a leader for the people." Abraham said, "And of my descendants?" Allah said, "My covenant does not include the wrongdoers

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذ جَعَلنَا البَيتَ مَثابَةً لِلنّاسِ وَأَمنًا وَاتَّخِذوا مِن مَقامِ إِبراهيمَ مُصَلًّى ۖ وَعَهِدنا إِلىٰ إِبراهيمَ وَإِسماعيلَ أَن طَهِّرا بَيتِيَ لِلطّائِفينَ وَالعاكِفينَ وَالرُّكَّعِ السُّجودِ
blank: w-ʾidh jaʿalnāl-bayt mathābat l-n-nās w-ʾamn w-ttakhidhū m maqām ʾibrāhīm muṣall w-ʿahidnā ʾilā ʾibrāhīm w-ʾismāʿīl ʾ ṭahhirā baytiy l-ṭ-ṭāʾifīn w-l-ʿākifīn w-r-rukkaʿ s-sujūd
english_saheeh_international: And mention when We made the House a place of return for the people and a place of security. And take, O believers, from the standing place of Abraham a place of prayer. And We charged Abraham and Ishmael, saying, "Purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who are staying there for worship and those who bow and prostrate in prayer

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذ قالَ إِبراهيمُ رَبِّ اجعَل هٰذا بَلَدًا آمِنًا وَارزُق أَهلَهُ مِنَ الثَّمَراتِ مَن آمَنَ مِنهُم بِاللَّهِ وَاليَومِ الآخِرِ ۖ قالَ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَأُمَتِّعُهُ قَليلًا ثُمَّ أَضطَرُّهُ إِلىٰ عَذابِ النّارِ ۖ وَبِئسَ المَصيرُ
blank: w-ʾidh qāl ʾibrāhīm rabb jʿal hādhā balad ʾāmin w-rzuq ʾahlahū min th-thamarāt m ʾāman minhum b-llāh w-l-yawmil-ʾākhir qāl w-m kafar f-ʾumattiʿuhū qalīl thumm ʾaḍṭarruhū ʾilā ʿadhāb n-nār w-biʾsal-maṣīr
english_saheeh_international: And mention when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this a secure city and provide its people with fruits - whoever of them believes in Allah and the Last Day." Allah said. "And whoever disbelieves - I will grant him enjoyment for a little; then I will force him to the punishment of the Fire, and wretched is the destination

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذ يَرفَعُ إِبراهيمُ القَواعِدَ مِنَ البَيتِ وَإِسماعيلُ رَبَّنا تَقَبَّل مِنّا ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
blank: w-ʾidh yarfaʿ ʾibrāhīmul-qawāʿid minal-bayt w-ʾismāʿīl rabbanā taqabbal minmā ʾinnak ʾant s-samīʿul-ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: And mention when Abraham was raising the foundations of the House and with him Ishmael, saying, "Our Lord, accept this from us. Indeed You are the Hearing, the Knowing

arabic_uthmani: رَبَّنا وَاجعَلنا مُسلِمَينِ لَكَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِنا أُمَّةً مُسلِمَةً لَكَ وَأَرِنا مَناسِكَنا وَتُب عَلَينا ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ التَّوّابُ الرَّحيمُ
blank: rabbanā w-jʿalnā muslimayn lak w-m dhurriyyatinā ʾummatam-muslimat lak w-ʾarinā manāsikanā w-tub ʿalaynā ʾinnak ʾant t-tawwāb r-raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: Our Lord, and make us Muslims in submission to You and from our descendants a Muslim nation in submission to You. And show us our rites and accept our repentance. Indeed, You are the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful

arabic_uthmani: رَبَّنا وَابعَث فيهِم رَسولًا مِنهُم يَتلو عَلَيهِم آياتِكَ وَيُعَلِّمُهُمُ الكِتابَ وَالحِكمَةَ وَيُزَكّيهِم ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ العَزيزُ الحَكيمُ
blank: rabbanā w-bʿath fīhim rasūlam-minhum yatlū ʿalayhim ʾāyātik w-yuʿallimuhumul-kitāb w-l-ḥikmat w-yuzakkīhim ʾinnak ʾantal-ʿazīzul-ḥakīm
english_saheeh_international: Our Lord, and send among them a messenger from themselves who will recite to them Your verses and teach them the Book and wisdom and purify them. Indeed, You are the Exalted in Might, the Wise

arabic_uthmani: وَمَن يَرغَبُ عَن مِلَّةِ إِبراهيمَ إِلّا مَن سَفِهَ نَفسَهُ ۚ وَلَقَدِ اصطَفَيناهُ فِي الدُّنيا ۖ وَإِنَّهُ فِي الآخِرَةِ لَمِنَ الصّالِحينَ
blank: w-m yarghab ʿam-millat ʾibrāhīm ʾillā m safih nafsahū w-l-qad ṣṭafaynāh fī d-dunyā w-ʾinnahū fīl-ʾākhirat l-min ṣ-ṣāliḥīn
english_saheeh_international: And who would be averse to the religion of Abraham except one who makes a fool of himself. And We had chosen him in this world, and indeed he, in the Hereafter, will be among the righteous

arabic_uthmani: إِذ قالَ لَهُ رَبُّهُ أَسلِم ۖ قالَ أَسلَمتُ لِرَبِّ العالَمينَ
blank: ʾidh qāl lahū rabbuhū ʾaslim qāl ʾaslamt l-rabbil-ʿālamīn
english_saheeh_international: When his Lord said to him, "Submit", he said "I have submitted in Islam to the Lord of the worlds

arabic_uthmani: وَوَصّىٰ بِها إِبراهيمُ بَنيهِ وَيَعقوبُ يا بَنِيَّ إِنَّ اللَّهَ اصطَفىٰ لَكُمُ الدّينَ فَلا تَموتُنَّ إِلّا وَأَنتُم مُسلِمونَ
blank: w-waṣṣā bihā ʾibrāhīm banīh w-yaʿqūb yā-baniyy ʾinn llāh ṣṭafā lakum d-dīn f-lā tamūtunn ʾillā w-ʾantum muslimūn
english_saheeh_international: And Abraham instructed his sons to do the same and so did Jacob, saying, "O my sons, indeed Allah has chosen for you this religion, so do not die except while you are Muslims

arabic_uthmani: أَم كُنتُم شُهَداءَ إِذ حَضَرَ يَعقوبَ المَوتُ إِذ قالَ لِبَنيهِ ما تَعبُدونَ مِن بَعدي قالوا نَعبُدُ إِلٰهَكَ وَإِلٰه آبائِكَ إِبراهيمَ وَإِسماعيلَ وَإِسحاقَ إِلٰهًا واحِدًا وَنَحنُ لَهُ مُسلِمونَ
blank: ʾam kuntum shuhadāʾ ʾidh ḥaḍar yaʿqūbal-mawt ʾidh qāl l-banīh mā taʿbudūn m baʿdī qālū naʿbud ʾilāhak w-ʾilāh ʾābāʾik ʾibrāhīm w-ʾismāʿīl w-ʾisḥāq ʾilāh wāḥid w-naḥn lahū muslimūn
english_saheeh_international: Or were you witnesses when death approached Jacob, when he said to his sons, "What will you worship after me?" They said, "We will worship your God and the God of your fathers, Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac - one God. And we are Muslims in submission to Him

arabic_uthmani: تِلكَ أُمَّةٌ قَد خَلَت ۖ لَها ما كَسَبَت وَلَكُم ما كَسَبتُم ۖ وَلا تُسأَلونَ عَمّا كانوا يَعمَلونَ
blank: tilk ʾummat qad khalat lahā mā kasabat w-lakum mā kasabtum w-lā tusʾalūn ʿammā kānū yaʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: That was a nation which has passed on. It will have the consequence of what it earned, and you will have what you have earned. And you will not be asked about what they used to do

arabic_uthmani: وَقالوا كونوا هودًا أَو نَصارىٰ تَهتَدوا ۗ قُل بَل مِلَّةَ إِبراهيمَ حَنيفًا ۖ وَما كانَ مِنَ المُشرِكينَ
blank: w-qālū kūnū hūd ʾaw naṣārā tahtadū qul bal millat ʾibrāhīm ḥanīf w-mā kān minal-mushrikīn
english_saheeh_international: They say, "Be Jews or Christians so you will be guided." Say, "Rather, we follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth, and he was not of the polytheists

arabic_uthmani: قولوا آمَنّا بِاللَّهِ وَما أُنزِلَ إِلَينا وَما أُنزِلَ إِلىٰ إِبراهيمَ وَإِسماعيلَ وَإِسحاقَ وَيَعقوبَ وَالأَسباطِ وَما أوتِيَ موسىٰ وَعيسىٰ وَما أوتِيَ النَّبِيّونَ مِن رَبِّهِم لا نُفَرِّقُ بَينَ أَحَدٍ مِنهُم وَنَحنُ لَهُ مُسلِمونَ
blank: qūlū ʾāmannā b-llāh w-mā ʾunzil ʾilaynā w-mā ʾunzil ʾilā ʾibrāhīm w-ʾismāʿīl w-ʾisḥāq w-yaʿqūb w-l-ʾasbāṭ w-mā ʾūtiy mūsā w-ʿīsā w-mā ʾūtiy n-nabiyyūn m rabbihim lā nufarriq bayn ʾaḥad minhum w-naḥn lahū muslimūn
english_saheeh_international: Say, O believers, "We have believed in Allah and what has been revealed to us and what has been revealed to Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the Descendants and what was given to Moses and Jesus and what was given to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims in submission to Him

arabic_uthmani: فَإِن آمَنوا بِمِثلِ ما آمَنتُم بِهِ فَقَدِ اهتَدَوا ۖ وَإِن تَوَلَّوا فَإِنَّما هُم في شِقاقٍ ۖ فَسَيَكفيكَهُمُ اللَّهُ ۚ وَهُوَ السَّميعُ العَليمُ
blank: f-ʾ ʾāmanū b-mithl mā ʾāmantum bihī f-qad htadaw w-ʾ tawallaw f-ʾinnamā hum fī shiqāq f-s-yakfīkahum llāh w-huw s-samīʿul-ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: So if they believe in the same as you believe in, then they have been rightly guided; but if they turn away, they are only in dissension, and Allah will be sufficient for you against them. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing

arabic_uthmani: صِبغَةَ اللَّهِ ۖ وَمَن أَحسَنُ مِنَ اللَّهِ صِبغَةً ۖ وَنَحنُ لَهُ عابِدونَ
blank: ṣibghat llāh w-m ʾaḥsan min llāh ṣibghat w-naḥn lahū ʿābidūn
english_saheeh_international: And say, "Ours is the religion of Allah. And who is better than Allah in ordaining religion? And we are worshippers of Him

arabic_uthmani: قُل أَتُحاجّونَنا فِي اللَّهِ وَهُوَ رَبُّنا وَرَبُّكُم وَلَنا أَعمالُنا وَلَكُم أَعمالُكُم وَنَحنُ لَهُ مُخلِصونَ
blank: qul ʾ-tuḥājjūnanā fī llāh w-huw rabbunā w-rabbukum w-lanā ʾaʿmālunā w-lakum ʾaʿmālukum w-naḥn lahū mukhliṣūn
english_saheeh_international: Say, O Muhammad, "Do you argue with us about Allah while He is our Lord and your Lord? For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. And we are sincere in deed and intention to Him

arabic_uthmani: أَم تَقولونَ إِنَّ إِبراهيمَ وَإِسماعيلَ وَإِسحاقَ وَيَعقوبَ وَالأَسباطَ كانوا هودًا أَو نَصارىٰ ۗ قُل أَأَنتُم أَعلَمُ أَمِ اللَّهُ ۗ وَمَن أَظلَمُ مِمَّن كَتَمَ شَهادَةً عِندَهُ مِنَ اللَّهِ ۗ وَمَا اللَّهُ بِغافِلٍ عَمّا تَعمَلونَ
blank: ʾam taqūlūn ʾinn ʾibrāhīm w-ʾismāʿīl w-ʾisḥāq w-yaʿqūb w-l-ʾasbāṭ kānū hūd ʾaw naṣārā qul ʾ-ʾantum ʾaʿlam ʾam llāh w-m ʾaẓlam mimm katam shahādat ʿindahū min llāh w-mā llāh b-ghāfil ʿammā taʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: Or do you say that Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the Descendants were Jews or Christians? Say, "Are you more knowing or is Allah?" And who is more unjust than one who conceals a testimony he has from Allah? And Allah is not unaware of what you do

arabic_uthmani: تِلكَ أُمَّةٌ قَد خَلَت ۖ لَها ما كَسَبَت وَلَكُم ما كَسَبتُم ۖ وَلا تُسأَلونَ عَمّا كانوا يَعمَلونَ
blank: tilk ʾummat qad khalat lahā mā kasabat w-lakum mā kasabtum w-lā tusʾalūn ʿammā kānū yaʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: That is a nation which has passed on. It will have the consequence of what it earned, and you will have what you have earned. And you will not be asked about what they used to do

arabic_uthmani: ۞ سَيَقولُ السُّفَهاءُ مِنَ النّاسِ ما وَلّاهُم عَن قِبلَتِهِمُ الَّتي كانوا عَلَيها ۚ قُل لِلَّهِ المَشرِقُ وَالمَغرِبُ ۚ يَهدي مَن يَشاءُ إِلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
blank: s-yaqūl s-sufahāʾ min n-nās mā wallāhum ʿ qiblatihim llatī kānū ʿalayhā qul l-llāhil-mashriq w-l-maghrib yahdī m yashāʾ ʾilā ṣirāṭ mustaqīm
english_saheeh_international: The foolish among the people will say, "What has turned them away from their qiblah, which they used to face?" Say, "To Allah belongs the east and the west. He guides whom He wills to a straight path

arabic_uthmani: وَكَذٰلِكَ جَعَلناكُم أُمَّةً وَسَطًا لِتَكونوا شُهَداءَ عَلَى النّاسِ وَيَكونَ الرَّسولُ عَلَيكُم شَهيدًا ۗ وَما جَعَلنَا القِبلَةَ الَّتي كُنتَ عَلَيها إِلّا لِنَعلَمَ مَن يَتَّبِعُ الرَّسولَ مِمَّن يَنقَلِبُ عَلىٰ عَقِبَيهِ ۚ وَإِن كانَت لَكَبيرَةً إِلّا عَلَى الَّذينَ هَدَى اللَّهُ ۗ وَما كانَ اللَّهُ لِيُضيعَ إيمانَكُم ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بِالنّاسِ لَرَءوفٌ رَحيمٌ
blank: w-k-dhālik jaʿalnākum ʾummat wasaṭ l-takūnū shuhadāʾ ʿalā n-nās w-yakūn r-rasūl ʿalaykum shahīd w-mā jaʿalnāl-qiblat llatī kunt ʿalayhā ʾillā l-naʿlam m yattabiʿ r-rasūl mimm yanqalib ʿalā ʿaqibayh w-ʾ kānat l-kabīrat ʾillā ʿalālladhīn hadā llāh w-mā kān llāh l-yuḍīʿ ʾīmānakum ʾinn llāh b-n-nās l-raʾūf raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: And thus we have made you a just community that you will be witnesses over the people and the Messenger will be a witness over you. And We did not make the qiblah which you used to face except that We might make evident who would follow the Messenger from who would turn back on his heels. And indeed, it is difficult except for those whom Allah has guided. And never would Allah have caused you to lose your faith. Indeed Allah is, to the people, Kind and Merciful

arabic_uthmani: قَد نَرىٰ تَقَلُّبَ وَجهِكَ فِي السَّماءِ ۖ فَلَنُوَلِّيَنَّكَ قِبلَةً تَرضاها ۚ فَوَلِّ وَجهَكَ شَطرَ المَسجِدِ الحَرامِ ۚ وَحَيثُ ما كُنتُم فَوَلّوا وُجوهَكُم شَطرَهُ ۗ وَإِنَّ الَّذينَ أوتُوا الكِتابَ لَيَعلَمونَ أَنَّهُ الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّهِم ۗ وَمَا اللَّهُ بِغافِلٍ عَمّا يَعمَلونَ
blank: qad narā taqallub wajhik fī s-samāʾ f-l-nuwalliyannak qiblat tarḍāhā f-wall wajhak shaṭral-masjidil-ḥarām w-ḥayth mā kuntum f-wallū wujūhakum shaṭrahū w-ʾinnalladhīn ʾūtūl-kitāb l-yaʿlamūn ʾannahul-ḥaqq m rabbihim w-mā llāh b-ghāfil ʿammā yaʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: We have certainly seen the turning of your face, O Muhammad, toward the heaven, and We will surely turn you to a qiblah with which you will be pleased. So turn your face toward al-Masjid al-Haram. And wherever you believers are, turn your faces toward it in prayer. Indeed, those who have been given the Scripture well know that it is the truth from their Lord. And Allah is not unaware of what you do

arabic_uthmani: وَلَئِن أَتَيتَ الَّذينَ أوتُوا الكِتابَ بِكُلِّ آيَةٍ ما تَبِعوا قِبلَتَكَ ۚ وَما أَنتَ بِتابِعٍ قِبلَتَهُم ۚ وَما بَعضُهُم بِتابِعٍ قِبلَةَ بَعضٍ ۚ وَلَئِنِ اتَّبَعتَ أَهواءَهُم مِن بَعدِ ما جاءَكَ مِنَ العِلمِ ۙ إِنَّكَ إِذًا لَمِنَ الظّالِمينَ
blank: w-l-ʾ ʾataytalladhīn ʾūtūl-kitāb b-kull ʾāyat mā tabiʿū qiblatak w-mā ʾant b-tābiʿ qiblatahum w-mā baʿḍuhum b-tābiʿ qiblat baʿḍ w-l-ʾin ttabaʿt ʾahwāʾahum m baʿd mā jāʾak minal-ʿilm ʾinnak ʾidh l-min ẓ-ẓālimīn
english_saheeh_international: And if you brought to those who were given the Scripture every sign, they would not follow your qiblah. Nor will you be a follower of their qiblah. Nor would they be followers of one another's qiblah. So if you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, indeed, you would then be among the wrongdoers

arabic_uthmani: الَّذينَ آتَيناهُمُ الكِتابَ يَعرِفونَهُ كَما يَعرِفونَ أَبناءَهُم ۖ وَإِنَّ فَريقًا مِنهُم لَيَكتُمونَ الحَقَّ وَهُم يَعلَمونَ
blank: alladhīn ʾātaynāhumul-kitāb yaʿrifūnahū k-mā yaʿrifūn ʾabnāʾahum w-ʾinn farīqam-minhum l-yaktumūnal-ḥaqq w-hum yaʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: Those to whom We gave the Scripture know him as they know their own sons. But indeed, a party of them conceal the truth while they know it

arabic_uthmani: الحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكَ ۖ فَلا تَكونَنَّ مِنَ المُمتَرينَ
blank: al-ḥaqq m rabbik f-lā takūnann minal-mumtarīn
english_saheeh_international: The truth is from your Lord, so never be among the doubters

arabic_uthmani: وَلِكُلٍّ وِجهَةٌ هُوَ مُوَلّيها ۖ فَاستَبِقُوا الخَيراتِ ۚ أَينَ ما تَكونوا يَأتِ بِكُمُ اللَّهُ جَميعًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلىٰ كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَديرٌ
blank: w-l-kull wijhat huw muwallīhā f-stabiqūl-khayrāt ʾayn mā takūnū yaʾt bikum llāh jamīʿ ʾinn llāh ʿalā kull shayʾ qadīr
english_saheeh_international: For each religious following is a direction toward which it faces. So race to all that is good. Wherever you may be, Allah will bring you forth for judgement all together. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent

arabic_uthmani: وَمِن حَيثُ خَرَجتَ فَوَلِّ وَجهَكَ شَطرَ المَسجِدِ الحَرامِ ۖ وَإِنَّهُ لَلحَقُّ مِن رَبِّكَ ۗ وَمَا اللَّهُ بِغافِلٍ عَمّا تَعمَلونَ
blank: w-m ḥayth kharajt f-wall wajhak shaṭral-masjidil-ḥarām w-ʾinnahū l-l-ḥaqq m rabbik w-mā llāh b-ghāfil ʿammā taʿmalūn
english_saheeh_international: So from wherever you go out for prayer, O Muhammad turn your face toward al- Masjid al-Haram, and indeed, it is the truth from your Lord. And Allah is not unaware of what you do

arabic_uthmani: وَمِن حَيثُ خَرَجتَ فَوَلِّ وَجهَكَ شَطرَ المَسجِدِ الحَرامِ ۚ وَحَيثُ ما كُنتُم فَوَلّوا وُجوهَكُم شَطرَهُ لِئَلّا يَكونَ لِلنّاسِ عَلَيكُم حُجَّةٌ إِلَّا الَّذينَ ظَلَموا مِنهُم فَلا تَخشَوهُم وَاخشَوني وَلِأُتِمَّ نِعمَتي عَلَيكُم وَلَعَلَّكُم تَهتَدونَ
blank: w-m ḥayth kharajt f-wall wajhak shaṭral-masjidil-ḥarām w-ḥayth mā kuntum f-wallū wujūhakum shaṭrahū l-ʾallā yakūn l-n-nās ʿalaykum ḥujjat ʾillālladhīn ẓalamū minhum f-lā takhshawhum w-khshawnī w-l-ʾutimm niʿmatī ʿalaykum w-laʿallakum tahtadūn
english_saheeh_international: And from wherever you go out for prayer, turn your face toward al-Masjid al-Haram. And wherever you believers may be, turn your faces toward it in order that the people will not have any argument against you, except for those of them who commit wrong; so fear them not but fear Me. And it is so I may complete My favor upon you and that you may be guided

arabic_uthmani: كَما أَرسَلنا فيكُم رَسولًا مِنكُم يَتلو عَلَيكُم آياتِنا وَيُزَكّيكُم وَيُعَلِّمُكُمُ الكِتابَ وَالحِكمَةَ وَيُعَلِّمُكُم ما لَم تَكونوا تَعلَمونَ
blank: k-mā ʾarsalnā fīkum rasūlam-minkum yatlū ʿalaykum ʾāyātinā w-yuzakkīkum w-yuʿallimukumul-kitāb w-l-ḥikmat w-yuʿallimukum mā lam takūnū taʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: Just as We have sent among you a messenger from yourselves reciting to you Our verses and purifying you and teaching you the Book and wisdom and teaching you that which you did not know

arabic_uthmani: فَاذكُروني أَذكُركُم وَاشكُروا لي وَلا تَكفُرونِ
blank: f-dhkurūnī ʾadhkurkum w-shkurū lī w-lā takfurūn
english_saheeh_international: So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنُوا استَعينوا بِالصَّبرِ وَالصَّلاةِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ مَعَ الصّابِرينَ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū staʿīnū b-ṣ-ṣabr w-ṣ-ṣalāt ʾinn llāh maʿ ṣ-ṣābirīn
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient

arabic_uthmani: وَلا تَقولوا لِمَن يُقتَلُ في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ أَمواتٌ ۚ بَل أَحياءٌ وَلٰكِن لا تَشعُرونَ
blank: w-lā taqūlū l-m yuqtal fī sabīl llāh ʾamwāt bal ʾaḥyāʾ w-lāk lā tashʿurūn
english_saheeh_international: And do not say about those who are killed in the way of Allah, "They are dead." Rather, they are alive, but you perceive it not

arabic_uthmani: وَلَنَبلُوَنَّكُم بِشَيءٍ مِنَ الخَوفِ وَالجوعِ وَنَقصٍ مِنَ الأَموالِ وَالأَنفُسِ وَالثَّمَراتِ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ الصّابِرينَ
blank: w-l-nabluwannakum b-shayʾ minal-khawf w-l-jūʿ w-naqṣ minal-ʾamwāl w-l-ʾanfus w-th-thamarāt w-bashshir ṣ-ṣābirīn
english_saheeh_international: And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruits, but give good tidings to the patient

arabic_uthmani: الَّذينَ إِذا أَصابَتهُم مُصيبَةٌ قالوا إِنّا لِلَّهِ وَإِنّا إِلَيهِ راجِعونَ
blank: alladhīn ʾidhā ʾaṣābathum muṣībat qālū ʾinnā l-llāh w-ʾinnā ʾilayh rājiʿūn
english_saheeh_international: Who, when disaster strikes them, say, "Indeed we belong to Allah, and indeed to Him we will return

arabic_uthmani: أُولٰئِكَ عَلَيهِم صَلَواتٌ مِن رَبِّهِم وَرَحمَةٌ ۖ وَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ المُهتَدونَ
blank: ʾulāʾik ʿalayhim ṣalawāt m rabbihim w-raḥmat w-ʾulāʾik humul-muhtadūn
english_saheeh_international: Those are the ones upon whom are blessings from their Lord and mercy. And it is those who are the rightly guided

arabic_uthmani: ۞ إِنَّ الصَّفا وَالمَروَةَ مِن شَعائِرِ اللَّهِ ۖ فَمَن حَجَّ البَيتَ أَوِ اعتَمَرَ فَلا جُناحَ عَلَيهِ أَن يَطَّوَّفَ بِهِما ۚ وَمَن تَطَوَّعَ خَيرًا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ شاكِرٌ عَليمٌ
blank: ʾinn ṣ-ṣafā w-l-marwat m shaʿāʾir llāh f-m hajjal-bayt ʾaw ʿtamar f-lā junāḥ ʿalayh ʾ yaṭṭawwaf bihimā w-m taṭawwaʿ khayr f-ʾinn llāh shākir ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, as-Safa and al-Marwah are among the symbols of Allah. So whoever makes Hajj to the House or performs 'umrah - there is no blame upon him for walking between them. And whoever volunteers good - then indeed, Allah is appreciative and Knowing

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَكتُمونَ ما أَنزَلنا مِنَ البَيِّناتِ وَالهُدىٰ مِن بَعدِ ما بَيَّنّاهُ لِلنّاسِ فِي الكِتابِ ۙ أُولٰئِكَ يَلعَنُهُمُ اللَّهُ وَيَلعَنُهُمُ اللّاعِنونَ
blank: ʾinnalladhīn yaktumūn mā ʾanzalnā minal-bayyināt w-l-hudā m baʿd mā bayyannāh l-n-nās fīl-kitāb ʾulāʾik yalʿanuhum llāh w-yalʿanuhumul-lāʿinūn
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, those who conceal what We sent down of clear proofs and guidance after We made it clear for the people in the Scripture - those are cursed by Allah and cursed by those who curse

arabic_uthmani: إِلَّا الَّذينَ تابوا وَأَصلَحوا وَبَيَّنوا فَأُولٰئِكَ أَتوبُ عَلَيهِم ۚ وَأَنَا التَّوّابُ الرَّحيمُ
blank: ʾillālladhīn tābū w-ʾaṣlaḥū w-bayyanū f-ʾulāʾik ʾatūb ʿalayhim w-ʾan t-tawwāb r-raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: Except for those who repent and correct themselves and make evident what they concealed. Those - I will accept their repentance, and I am the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ الَّذينَ كَفَروا وَماتوا وَهُم كُفّارٌ أُولٰئِكَ عَلَيهِم لَعنَةُ اللَّهِ وَالمَلائِكَةِ وَالنّاسِ أَجمَعينَ
blank: ʾinnalladhīn kafarū w-mātū w-hum kuffār ʾulāʾik ʿalayhim laʿnat llāh w-l-malāʾikat w-n-nās ʾajmaʿīn
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, those who disbelieve and die while they are disbelievers - upon them will be the curse of Allah and of the angels and the people, all together

arabic_uthmani: خالِدينَ فيها ۖ لا يُخَفَّفُ عَنهُمُ العَذابُ وَلا هُم يُنظَرونَ
blank: khālidīn fīhā lā yukhaffaf ʿanhumul-ʿadhāb w-lā hum yunẓarūn
english_saheeh_international: Abiding eternally therein. The punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved

arabic_uthmani: وَإِلٰهُكُم إِلٰهٌ واحِدٌ ۖ لا إِلٰهَ إِلّا هُوَ الرَّحمٰنُ الرَّحيمُ
blank: w-ʾilāhukum ʾilāh wāḥid lā ʾilāh ʾillā huw r-raḥmān r-raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: And your god is one God. There is no deity worthy of worship except Him, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ في خَلقِ السَّماواتِ وَالأَرضِ وَاختِلافِ اللَّيلِ وَالنَّهارِ وَالفُلكِ الَّتي تَجري فِي البَحرِ بِما يَنفَعُ النّاسَ وَما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ مِنَ السَّماءِ مِن ماءٍ فَأَحيا بِهِ الأَرضَ بَعدَ مَوتِها وَبَثَّ فيها مِن كُلِّ دابَّةٍ وَتَصريفِ الرِّياحِ وَالسَّحابِ المُسَخَّرِ بَينَ السَّماءِ وَالأَرضِ لَآياتٍ لِقَومٍ يَعقِلونَ
blank: ʾinn fī khalq s-samāwāt w-l-ʾarḍ w-khtilāfil-layl w-n-nahār w-l-fulk llatī tajrī fīl-baḥr b-mā yanfaʿ n-nās w-mā ʾanzal llāh min s-samāʾ m māʾ f-ʾaḥyā bihil-ʾarḍ baʿd mawtihā w-bathth fīhā m kull dābbat w-taṣrīf r-riyāḥ w-s-saḥābil-musakhkhar bayn s-samāʾ w-l-ʾarḍ l-ʾāyāt l-qawm yaʿqilūn
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and earth, and the alternation of the night and the day, and the great ships which sail through the sea with that which benefits people, and what Allah has sent down from the heavens of rain, giving life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness and dispersing therein every kind of moving creature, and His directing of the winds and the clouds controlled between the heaven and the earth are signs for a people who use reason

arabic_uthmani: وَمِنَ النّاسِ مَن يَتَّخِذُ مِن دونِ اللَّهِ أَندادًا يُحِبّونَهُم كَحُبِّ اللَّهِ ۖ وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا أَشَدُّ حُبًّا لِلَّهِ ۗ وَلَو يَرَى الَّذينَ ظَلَموا إِذ يَرَونَ العَذابَ أَنَّ القُوَّةَ لِلَّهِ جَميعًا وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ شَديدُ العَذابِ
blank: w-min n-nās m yattakhidh m dūn llāh ʾandād yuḥibbūnahum k-ḥubb llāh w-lladhīn ʾāmanū ʾashadd ḥubb l-llāh w-law yarālladhīn ẓalamū ʾidh yarawnal-ʿadhāb ʾannal-quwwat l-llāh jamīʿ w-ʾann llāh shadīdul-ʿadhāb
english_saheeh_international: And yet, among the people are those who take other than Allah as equals to Him. They love them as they should love Allah. But those who believe are stronger in love for Allah. And if only they who have wronged would consider that when they see the punishment, they will be certain that all power belongs to Allah and that Allah is severe in punishment

arabic_uthmani: إِذ تَبَرَّأَ الَّذينَ اتُّبِعوا مِنَ الَّذينَ اتَّبَعوا وَرَأَوُا العَذابَ وَتَقَطَّعَت بِهِمُ الأَسبابُ
blank: ʾidh tabarraʾalladhīn ttubiʿū minalladhīn ttabaʿū w-raʾawul-ʿadhāb w-taqaṭṭaʿat bihimul-ʾasbāb
english_saheeh_international: And they should consider that when those who have been followed disassociate themselves from those who followed them, and they all see the punishment, and cut off from them are the ties of relationship

arabic_uthmani: وَقالَ الَّذينَ اتَّبَعوا لَو أَنَّ لَنا كَرَّةً فَنَتَبَرَّأَ مِنهُم كَما تَبَرَّءوا مِنّا ۗ كَذٰلِكَ يُريهِمُ اللَّهُ أَعمالَهُم حَسَراتٍ عَلَيهِم ۖ وَما هُم بِخارِجينَ مِنَ النّارِ
blank: w-qālalladhīn ttabaʿū law ʾann lanā karrat f-natabarraʾ minhum k-mā tabarraʾū minnā k-dhālik yurīhim llāh ʾaʿmālahum ḥasarāt ʿalayhim w-mā hum b-khārijīn min n-nār
english_saheeh_international: Those who followed will say, "If only we had another turn at worldly life so we could disassociate ourselves from them as they have disassociated themselves from us." Thus will Allah show them their deeds as regrets upon them. And they are never to emerge from the Fire

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا النّاسُ كُلوا مِمّا فِي الأَرضِ حَلالًا طَيِّبًا وَلا تَتَّبِعوا خُطُواتِ الشَّيطانِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لَكُم عَدُوٌّ مُبينٌ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhā n-nās kulū mimmā fīl-ʾarḍ ḥalāl ṭayyib w-lā tattabiʿū khuṭuwāt sh-shayṭān ʾinnahū lakum ʿaduww mubīn
english_saheeh_international: O mankind, eat from whatever is on earth that is lawful and good and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّما يَأمُرُكُم بِالسّوءِ وَالفَحشاءِ وَأَن تَقولوا عَلَى اللَّهِ ما لا تَعلَمونَ
blank: ʾinnamā yaʾmurukum b-s-sūʾ w-l-faḥshāʾ w-ʾ taqūlū ʿalā llāh mā lā taʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: He only orders you to evil and immorality and to say about Allah what you do not know

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُمُ اتَّبِعوا ما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ قالوا بَل نَتَّبِعُ ما أَلفَينا عَلَيهِ آباءَنا ۗ أَوَلَو كانَ آباؤُهُم لا يَعقِلونَ شَيئًا وَلا يَهتَدونَ
blank: w-ʾidhā qīl lahum ttabiʿū mā ʾanzal llāh qālū bal nattabiʿ mā ʾalfaynā ʿalayh ʾābāʾanā ʾ-w-law kān ʾābāʾuhum lā yaʿqilūn shayʾ w-lā yahtadūn
english_saheeh_international: And when it is said to them, "Follow what Allah has revealed," they say, "Rather, we will follow that which we found our fathers doing." Even though their fathers understood nothing, nor were they guided

arabic_uthmani: وَمَثَلُ الَّذينَ كَفَروا كَمَثَلِ الَّذي يَنعِقُ بِما لا يَسمَعُ إِلّا دُعاءً وَنِداءً ۚ صُمٌّ بُكمٌ عُميٌ فَهُم لا يَعقِلونَ
blank: w-mathalulladhīn kafarū k-mathalilladhī yanʿiq b-mā lā yasmaʿ ʾillā duʿāʾ w-nidāʾ ṣumm bukm ʿumy f-hum lā yaʿqilūn
english_saheeh_international: The example of those who disbelieve is like that of one who shouts at what hears nothing but calls and cries cattle or sheep - deaf, dumb and blind, so they do not understand

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا كُلوا مِن طَيِّباتِ ما رَزَقناكُم وَاشكُروا لِلَّهِ إِن كُنتُم إِيّاهُ تَعبُدونَ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū kulū m ṭayyibātimā razaqnākum w-shkurū l-llāh ʾ kuntum ʾiyyāh taʿbudūn
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, eat from the good things which We have provided for you and be grateful to Allah if it is indeed Him that you worship

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّما حَرَّمَ عَلَيكُمُ المَيتَةَ وَالدَّمَ وَلَحمَ الخِنزيرِ وَما أُهِلَّ بِهِ لِغَيرِ اللَّهِ ۖ فَمَنِ اضطُرَّ غَيرَ باغٍ وَلا عادٍ فَلا إِثمَ عَلَيهِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
blank: ʾinnamā ḥarram ʿalaykumul-maytat w-d-dam w-l-laḥmal-khinzīr w-mā ʾuhill bihī l-ghayr llāh f-man ḍṭurr ghayr bāgh w-lā ʿād f-lā ʾithm ʿalayh ʾinn llāh ghafūr raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced by necessity, neither desiring it nor transgressing its limit, there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful

arabic_uthmani: إِنَّ الَّذينَ يَكتُمونَ ما أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ مِنَ الكِتابِ وَيَشتَرونَ بِهِ ثَمَنًا قَليلًا ۙ أُولٰئِكَ ما يَأكُلونَ في بُطونِهِم إِلَّا النّارَ وَلا يُكَلِّمُهُمُ اللَّهُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ وَلا يُزَكّيهِم وَلَهُم عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
blank: ʾinnalladhīn yaktumūn mā ʾanzal llāh minal-kitāb w-yashtarūn bihī thaman qalīl ʾulāʾik mā yaʾkulūn fī buṭūnihim ʾillā n-nār w-lā yukallimuhum llāh yawmal-qiyāmat w-lā yuzakkīhim w-lahum ʿadhāb ʾalīm
english_saheeh_international: Indeed, they who conceal what Allah has sent down of the Book and exchange it for a small price - those consume not into their bellies except the Fire. And Allah will not speak to them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them. And they will have a painful punishment

arabic_uthmani: أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ اشتَرَوُا الضَّلالَةَ بِالهُدىٰ وَالعَذابَ بِالمَغفِرَةِ ۚ فَما أَصبَرَهُم عَلَى النّارِ
blank: ʾulāʾikalladhīn shtaraw ḍ-ḍalālat b-l-hudā w-l-ʿadhāb b-l-maghfirat f-mā ʾaṣbarahum ʿalā n-nār
english_saheeh_international: Those are the ones who have exchanged guidance for error and forgiveness for punishment. How patient they are in pursuit of the Fire

arabic_uthmani: ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ نَزَّلَ الكِتابَ بِالحَقِّ ۗ وَإِنَّ الَّذينَ اختَلَفوا فِي الكِتابِ لَفي شِقاقٍ بَعيدٍ
blank: dhālik b-ʾann llāh nazzalal-kitāb b-l-ḥaqq w-ʾinnalladhīn khtalafū fīl-kitāb l-fī shiqāq baʿīd
english_saheeh_international: That is deserved by them because Allah has sent down the Book in truth. And indeed, those who differ over the Book are in extreme dissension

arabic_uthmani: ۞ لَيسَ البِرَّ أَن تُوَلّوا وُجوهَكُم قِبَلَ المَشرِقِ وَالمَغرِبِ وَلٰكِنَّ البِرَّ مَن آمَنَ بِاللَّهِ وَاليَومِ الآخِرِ وَالمَلائِكَةِ وَالكِتابِ وَالنَّبِيّينَ وَآتَى المالَ عَلىٰ حُبِّهِ ذَوِي القُربىٰ وَاليَتامىٰ وَالمَساكينَ وَابنَ السَّبيلِ وَالسّائِلينَ وَفِي الرِّقابِ وَأَقامَ الصَّلاةَ وَآتَى الزَّكاةَ وَالموفونَ بِعَهدِهِم إِذا عاهَدوا ۖ وَالصّابِرينَ فِي البَأساءِ وَالضَّرّاءِ وَحينَ البَأسِ ۗ أُولٰئِكَ الَّذينَ صَدَقوا ۖ وَأُولٰئِكَ هُمُ المُتَّقونَ
blank: laysal-birr ʾ tuwallū wujūhakum qibalal-mashriq w-l-maghrib w-lākinnal-birr m ʾāman b-llāh w-l-yawmil-ʾākhir w-l-malāʾikat w-l-kitāb w-n-nabiyyīn w-ʾātāl-māl ʿalā ḥubbihī dhawīl-qurbā w-l-yatāmā w-l-masākīn w-bn s-sabīl w-s-sāʾilīn w-fī r-riqāb w-ʾaqām ṣ-ṣalāt w-ʾātā z-zakāt w-l-mūfūn b-ʿahdihim ʾidhā ʿāhadū w-ṣ-ṣābirīn fīl-baʾsāʾ w-ḍ-ḍarrāʾ w-ḥīnal-baʾs ʾulāʾikalladhīn ṣadaqū w-ʾulāʾik humul-muttaqūn
english_saheeh_international: Righteousness is not that you turn your faces toward the east or the west, but true righteousness is in one who believes in Allah, the Last Day, the angels, the Book, and the prophets and gives wealth, in spite of love for it, to relatives, orphans, the needy, the traveler, those who ask for help, and for freeing slaves; and who establishes prayer and gives zakah; those who fulfill their promise when they promise; and those who are patient in poverty and hardship and during battle. Those are the ones who have been true, and it is those who are the righteous

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا كُتِبَ عَلَيكُمُ القِصاصُ فِي القَتلَى ۖ الحُرُّ بِالحُرِّ وَالعَبدُ بِالعَبدِ وَالأُنثىٰ بِالأُنثىٰ ۚ فَمَن عُفِيَ لَهُ مِن أَخيهِ شَيءٌ فَاتِّباعٌ بِالمَعروفِ وَأَداءٌ إِلَيهِ بِإِحسانٍ ۗ ذٰلِكَ تَخفيفٌ مِن رَبِّكُم وَرَحمَةٌ ۗ فَمَنِ اعتَدىٰ بَعدَ ذٰلِكَ فَلَهُ عَذابٌ أَليمٌ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū kutib ʿalaykumul-qiṣāṣ fīl-qatlāl-ḥurr b-l-ḥurr w-l-ʿabd b-l-ʿabd w-l-ʾunthā b-l-ʾunthā f-m ʿufiy lahū m ʾakhīh shayʾ f-ttibāʿ b-l-maʿrūf w-ʾadāʾ ʾilayh b-ʾiḥsān dhālik takhfīf m rabbikum w-raḥmat f-man ʿtadā baʿd dhālik f-lahū ʿadhāb ʾalīm
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, prescribed for you is legal retribution for those murdered - the free for the free, the slave for the slave, and the female for the female. But whoever overlooks from his brother anything, then there should be a suitable follow-up and payment to him with good conduct. This is an alleviation from your Lord and a mercy. But whoever transgresses after that will have a painful punishment

arabic_uthmani: وَلَكُم فِي القِصاصِ حَياةٌ يا أُولِي الأَلبابِ لَعَلَّكُم تَتَّقونَ
blank: w-lakum fīl-qiṣāṣ ḥayāt yā-ʾulīl-ʾalbāb laʿallakum tattaqūn
english_saheeh_international: And there is for you in legal retribution saving of life, O you people of understanding, that you may become righteous

arabic_uthmani: كُتِبَ عَلَيكُم إِذا حَضَرَ أَحَدَكُمُ المَوتُ إِن تَرَكَ خَيرًا الوَصِيَّةُ لِلوالِدَينِ وَالأَقرَبينَ بِالمَعروفِ ۖ حَقًّا عَلَى المُتَّقينَ
blank: kutib ʿalaykum ʾidhā ḥaḍar ʾaḥadakumul-mawt ʾ tarak khayr-il-waṣiyyat l-l-wālidayn w-l-ʾaqrabīn b-l-maʿrūf ḥaqq ʿalāl-muttaqīn
english_saheeh_international: Prescribed for you when death approaches any one of you if he leaves wealth is that he should make a bequest for the parents and near relatives according to what is acceptable - a duty upon the righteous

arabic_uthmani: فَمَن بَدَّلَهُ بَعدَما سَمِعَهُ فَإِنَّما إِثمُهُ عَلَى الَّذينَ يُبَدِّلونَهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَميعٌ عَليمٌ
blank: f-m baddalahū baʿd mā samiʿahū f-ʾinnamā ʾithmuhū ʿalālladhīn yubaddilūnahū ʾinn llāh samīʿ ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: Then whoever alters the bequest after he has heard it - the sin is only upon those who have altered it. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing

arabic_uthmani: فَمَن خافَ مِن موصٍ جَنَفًا أَو إِثمًا فَأَصلَحَ بَينَهُم فَلا إِثمَ عَلَيهِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
blank: f-m khāf m mūṣ janaf ʾaw ʾithm f-ʾaṣlaḥ baynahum f-lā ʾithm ʿalayh ʾinn llāh ghafūr raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: But if one fears from the bequeather some error or sin and corrects that which is between them, there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنوا كُتِبَ عَلَيكُمُ الصِّيامُ كَما كُتِبَ عَلَى الَّذينَ مِن قَبلِكُم لَعَلَّكُم تَتَّقونَ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū kutib ʿalaykum ṣ-ṣiyām k-mā kutib ʿalālladhīn m qablikum laʿallakum tattaqūn
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, decreed upon you is fasting as it was decreed upon those before you that you may become righteous

arabic_uthmani: أَيّامًا مَعدوداتٍ ۚ فَمَن كانَ مِنكُم مَريضًا أَو عَلىٰ سَفَرٍ فَعِدَّةٌ مِن أَيّامٍ أُخَرَ ۚ وَعَلَى الَّذينَ يُطيقونَهُ فِديَةٌ طَعامُ مِسكينٍ ۖ فَإِض رَمَضاوِيٌّ تَبَعَ ثَلاثَةَ أَيّامٍ ۚ ذٰلِكَ خَيرٌ لَهُ ۚ وَأَن تَصوموا خَيرٌ لَكُم ۖ إِن كُنتُم تَعلَمونَ
blank: ʾayyāmam-maʿdūdāt f-m kān minkum marīḍ ʾaw ʿalā safar f-ʿiddat m ʾayyām ʾukhar w-ʿalālladhīn yuṭīqūnahū fidyat ṭaʿām miskīn f-m taṭawwaʿ khayr f-huw khayr lahū w-ʾ taṣūmū khayr lakum ʾ kuntum taʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: Fasting for a limited number of days. So whoever among you is ill or on a journey during them - then an equal number of days are to be made up. And upon those who are able to fast, but with hardship - a ransom as substitute of feeding a poor person each day. And whoever volunteers excess - it is better for him. But to fast is best for you, if you only knew

arabic_uthmani: شَهرُ رَمَضانَ الَّذي أُنزِلَ فيهِ القُرآنُ هُدًى لِلنّاسِ وَبَيِّناتٍ مِنَ الهُدىٰ وَالفُرقانِ ۚ فَمَن شَهِدَ مِنكُمُ الشَّهرَ فَليَصُمهُ ۖ وَمَن كانَ مَريضًا أَو عَلىٰ سَفَرٍ فَعِدَّةٌ مِن أَيّامٍ أُخَرَ ۗ يُريدُ اللَّهُ بِكُمُ اليُسرَ وَلا يُريدُ بِكُمُ العُسرَ وَلِتُكمِلُوا العِدَّةَ وَلِتُكَبِّرُوا اللَّهَ عَلىٰ ما هَداكُم وَلَعَلَّكُم تَشكُرونَ
blank: shahr ramaḍānalladhī ʾunzil fīhil-qurʾān hud l-n-nās w-bayyināt minal-hudā w-l-furqān f-m shahid minkum sh-shahr f-l-yaṣumh w-m kān marīḍ ʾaw-ʿalā safar f-ʿiddat m ʾayyām ʾukhar yurīd llāh bikumul-yusr w-lā yurīd bikumul-ʿusr w-l-tukmilūl-ʿiddat w-l-tukabbirū llāh ʿalā mā hadākum w-laʿallakum tashkurūn
english_saheeh_international: The month of Ramadhan is that in which was revealed the Qur'an, a guidance for the people and clear proofs of guidance and criterion. So whoever sights the new moon of the month, let him fast it; and whoever is ill or on a journey - then an equal number of other days. Allah intends for you ease and does not intend for you hardship and wants for you to complete the period and to glorify Allah for that to which He has guided you; and perhaps you will be grateful

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذا سَأَلَكَ عِبادي عَنّي فَإِنّي قَريبٌ ۖ أُجيبُ دَعوَةَ الدّاعِ إِذا دَعانِ ۖ فَليَستَجيبوا لي وَليُؤمِنوا بي لَعَلَّهُم يَرشُدونَ
blank: w-ʾidhā saʾalak ʿibādī ʿannī f-ʾinnī qarīb ʾujīb daʿwat d-dāʿ ʾidhā daʿān f-l-yastajībū lī w-l-yuʾminū bī laʿallahum yarshudūn
english_saheeh_international: And when My servants ask you, O Muhammad, concerning Me - indeed I am near. I respond to the invocation of the supplicant when he calls upon Me. So let them respond to Me by obedience and believe in Me that they may be rightly guided

arabic_uthmani: أُحِلَّ لَكُم لَيلَةَ الصّيَامِ الرَّفَثُ إِلىٰ نِسائِكُم ۚ هُنَّ لِباسٌ لَكُم وَأَنتُم لِباسٌ لَهُنَّ ۗ عَلِمَ اللَّهُ أَنَّكُم كُنتُم تَختانونَ أَنفُسَكُم فَتابَ عَلَيكُم وَعَفا عَنكُم ۖ فَالآنَ باشِروهُنَّ وَابتَغوا ما كَتَبَ اللَّهُ لَكُم ۚ وَكُلوا وَاشرَبوا حَتّىٰ يَتَبَيَّنَ لَكُمُ الخَيطُ الأَبيَضُ مِنَ الخَيطِ الأَسوَدِ مِنَ الفَجرِ ۖ ثُمَّ أَتِمُّوا الصِّيامَ إِلَى اللَّيلِ ۚ وَلا تُباشِروهُنَّ وَأَنتُم عاكِفونَ فِي المَساجِدِ ۗ تِلكَ حُدودُ اللَّهِ فَلا تَقرَبوها ۗ كَذٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ آياتِهِ لِلنّاسِ لَعَلَّهُم يَتَّقونَ
blank: ʾuḥill lakum laylat ṣ-ṣiyām r-rafath ʾilā nisāʾikum hunn libās lakum w-ʾantum libās lahunn ʿalim llāh ʾannakum kuntum takhtānūn ʾanfusakum f-tāb ʿalaykum w-ʿafā ʿankum f-l-ʾān bāshirūhunn w-btaghū mā katab llāh lakum w-kulū w-shrabū ḥattā yatabayyan lakumul-khayṭul-ʾabyaḍ minal-khayṭil-ʾaswad minal-fajr thumm ʾatimmū ṣ-ṣiyām ʾilāl-layl w-lā tubāshirūhunn w-ʾantum ʿākifūn fīl-masājid tilk ḥudūd llāh f-lā taqrabūhā k-dhālik yubayyin llāh ʾāyātihī l-n-nās laʿallahum yattaqūn
english_saheeh_international: It has been made permissible for you the night preceding fasting to go to your wives for sexual relations. They are clothing for you and you are clothing for them. Allah knows that you used to deceive yourselves, so He accepted your repentance and forgave you. So now, have relations with them and seek that which Allah has decreed for you. And eat and drink until the white thread of dawn becomes distinct to you from the black thread of night. Then complete the fast until the sunset. And do not have relations with them as long as you are staying for worship in the mosques. These are the limits set by Allah, so do not approach them. Thus does Allah make clear to His ordinances to the people that they may become righteous

arabic_uthmani: وَلا تَأكُلوا أَموالَكُم بَينَكُم بِالباطِلِ وَتُدلوا بِها إِلَى الحُكّامِ لِتَأكُلوا فَريقًا مِن أَموالِ النّاسِ بِالإِثمِ وَأَنتُم تَعلَمونَ
blank: w-lā taʾkulū ʾamwālakum baynakum b-l-bāṭil w-tudlū bihā ʾilāl-ḥukkām l-taʾkulū farīqam-m ʾamwāl n-nās b-l-ʾithm w-ʾantum taʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: And do not consume one another's wealth unjustly or send it in bribery to the rulers in order that they might aid you to consume a portion of the wealth of the people in sin, while you know it is unlawful

arabic_uthmani: ۞ يَسأَلونَكَ عَنِ الأَهِلَّةِ ۖ قُل هِيَ مَواقيتُ لِلنّاسِ وَالحَجِّ ۗ وَلَيسَ البِرُّ بِأَن تَأتُوا البُيوتَ مِن ظُهورِها وَلٰكِنَّ البِرَّ مَنِ اتَّقىٰ ۗ وَأتُوا البُيوتَ مِن أَبوابِها ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُم تُفلِحونَ
blank: yasʾalūnak ʿanil-ʾahillat qul hiy mawāqīt l-n-nās w-l-ḥajj w-laysal-birr b-ʾ taʾtūl-buyūt m ẓuhūrihā w-lākinnal-birr man ttaqā w-ʾtūl-buyūt m ʾabwābihā w-ttaqū llāh laʿallakum tufliḥūn
english_saheeh_international: They ask you, O Muhammad, about the new moons. Say, "They are measurements of time for the people and for Hajj." And it is not righteousness to enter houses from the back, but righteousness is in one who fears Allah. And enter houses from their doors. And fear Allah that you may succeed

arabic_uthmani: وَقاتِلوا في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ الَّذينَ يُقاتِلونَكُم وَلا تَعتَدوا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُحِبُّ المُعتَدينَ
blank: w-qātilū fī sabīl llāhilladhīn yuqātilūnakum w-lā taʿtadū ʾinn llāh lā yuḥibbul-muʿtadīn
english_saheeh_international: Fight in the way of Allah those who fight you but do not transgress. Indeed. Allah does not like transgressors

arabic_uthmani: وَاقتُلوهُم حَيثُ ثَقِفتُموهُم وَأَخرِجوهُم مِن حَيثُ أَخرَجوكُم ۚ وَالفِتنَةُ أَشَدُّ مِنَ القَتلِ ۚ وَلا تُقاتِلوهُم عِندَ المَسجِدِ الحَرامِ حَتّىٰ يُقاتِلوكُم فيهِ ۖ فَإِن قاتَلوكُم فَاقتُلوهُم ۗ كَذٰلِكَ جَزاءُ الكافِرينَ
blank: w-qtulūhum ḥayth thaqiftumūhum w-ʾakhrijūhum m ḥayth ʾakhrajūkum w-l-fitnat ʾashadd minal-qatl w-lā tuqātilūhum ʿindal-masjidil-ḥarām ḥattā yuqātilūkum fīh f-ʾ qātalūkum f-qtulūhum k-dhālik jazāʾul-kāfirīn
english_saheeh_international: And kill them wherever you overtake them and expel them from wherever they have expelled you, and fitnah is worse than killing. And do not fight them at al-Masjid al- Haram until they fight you there. But if they fight you, then kill them. Such is the recompense of the disbelievers

arabic_uthmani: فَإِنِ انتَهَوا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
blank: f-ʾin ntahaw f-ʾinn llāh ghafūr raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: And if they cease, then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful

arabic_uthmani: وَقاتِلوهُم حَتّىٰ لا تَكونَ فِتنَةٌ وَيَكونَ الدّينُ لِلَّهِ ۖ فَإِنِ انتَهَوا فَلا عُدوانَ إِلّا عَلَى الظّالِمينَ
blank: w-qātilūhum ḥattā lā takūn fitnat w-yakūn d-dīn l-llāh f-ʾin ntahaw f-lā ʿudwān ʾillā ʿalā ẓ-ẓālimīn
english_saheeh_international: Fight them until there is no more fitnah and until worship is acknowledged to be for Allah. But if they cease, then there is to be no aggression except against the oppressors

arabic_uthmani: الشَّهرُ الحَرامُ بِالشَّهرِ الحَرامِ وَالحُرُماتُ قِصاصٌ ۚ فَمَنِ اعتَدىٰ عَلَيكُم فَاعتَدوا عَلَيهِ بِمِثلِ مَا اعتَدىٰ عَلَيكُم ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَاعلَموا أَنَّ اللَّهَ مَعَ المُتَّقينَ
blank: ash-shahrul-ḥarām b-sh-shahril-ḥarām w-l-ḥurumāt qiṣāṣ f-man ʿtadā ʿalaykum f-ʿtadū ʿalayh b-mithl mā ʿtadā ʿalaykum w-ttaqū llāh w-ʿlamū ʾann llāh maʿal-muttaqīn
english_saheeh_international: Fighting in the sacred month is for aggression committed in the sacred month, and for all violations is legal retribution. So whoever has assaulted you, then assault him in the same way that he has assaulted you. And fear Allah and know that Allah is with those who fear Him

arabic_uthmani: وَأَنفِقوا في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَلا تُلقوا بِأَيديكُم إِلَى التَّهلُكَةِ ۛ وَأَحسِنوا ۛ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ المُحسِنينَ
blank: w-ʾanfiqū fī sabīl llāh w-lā tulqū b-ʾaydīkum ʾilā t-tahlukat w-ʾaḥsinū ʾinn llāh yuḥibbul-muḥsinīn
english_saheeh_international: And spend in the way of Allah and do not throw yourselves with your own hands into destruction by refraining. And do good; indeed, Allah loves the doers of good

arabic_uthmani: وَأَتِمُّوا الحَجَّ وَالعُمرَةَ لِلَّهِ ۚ فَإِن أُحصِرتُم فَمَا استَيسَرَ مِنَ الهَديِ ۖ وَلا تَحلِقوا رُءوسَكُم حَتّىٰ يَبلُغَ الهَديُ مَحِلَّهُ ۚ فَمَن كانَ مِنكُم مَريضًا أَو بِهِ أَذًى مِن رَأسِهِ فَفِديَةٌ مِن صِيامٍ أَو صَدَقَةٍ أَو نُسُكٍ ۚ فَإِذا أَمِنتُم فَمَن تَمَتَّعَ بِالعُمرَةِ إِلَى الحَجِّ فَمَا استَيسَرَ مِنَ الهَديِ ۚ فَمَن لَم يَجِد فَصِيامُ ثَلاثَةِ أَيّامٍ فِي الحَجِّ وَسَبعَةٍ إِذا رَجَعتُم ۗ تِلكَ عَشَرَةٌ كامِلَةٌ ۗ ذٰلِكَ لِمَن لَم يَكُن أَهلُهُ حاضِرِي المَسجِدِ الحَرامِ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَاعلَموا أَنَّ اللَّهَ شَديدُ العِقابِ
blank: w-ʾatimmūl-ḥajj w-l-ʿumrat l-llāh f-ʾ ʾuḥṣirtum f-mā staysar minal-hady w-lā taḥliqū ruʾūsakum ḥattā yablughal-hady maḥillahū f-m kān minkum marīḍ ʾaw bihī ʾadham-m raʾsihī f-fidyat m ṣiyām ʾaw ṣadaqat ʾaw nusuk f-ʾidhā ʾamintum f-m tamattaʿ b-l-ʿumrat ʾilāl-ḥajj f-mā staysar minal-hady f-m lam yajid f-ṣiyām thalāthat ʾayyām fīl-ḥajj w-sabʿat ʾidhā rajaʿtum tilk ʿasharat kāmilat dhālik l-m lam yak ʾahluhū ḥāḍirīl-masjidil-ḥarām w-ttaqū llāh w-ʿlamū ʾann llāh shadīdul-ʿiqāb
english_saheeh_international: And complete the Hajj and 'umrah for Allah. But if you are prevented, then offer what can be obtained with ease of sacrificial animals. And do not shave your heads until the sacrificial animal has reached its place of slaughter. And whoever among you is ill or has an ailment of the head making shaving necessary must offer a ransom of fasting three days or charity or sacrifice. And when you are secure, then whoever performs 'umrah during the Hajj months followed by Hajj offers what can be obtained with ease of sacrificial animals. And whoever cannot find or afford such an animal - then a fast of three days during Hajj and of seven when you have returned home. Those are ten complete days. This is for those whose family is not in the area of al-Masjid al-Haram. And fear Allah and know that Allah is severe in penalty

arabic_uthmani: الحَجُّ أَشهُرٌ مَعلوماتٌ ۚ فَمَن فَرَضَ فيهِنَّ الحَجَّ فَلا رَفَثَ وَلا فُسوقَ وَلا جِدالَ فِي الحَجِّ ۗ وَما تَفعَلوا مِن خَيرٍ يَعلَمهُ اللَّهُ ۗ وَتَزَوَّدوا فَإِنَّ خَيرَ الزّادِ التَّقوىٰ ۚ وَاتَّقونِ يا أُولِي الأَلبابِ
blank: al-ḥajj ʾashhur maʿlūmāt f-m faraḍ fīhinnal-ḥajj f-lā rafath w-lā fusūq w-lā jidāl fīl-ḥajj w-mā tafʿalū m khayr yaʿlamh llāh w-tazawwadū f-ʾinn khayr z-zād t-taqwā w-ttaqūn yā-ʾulīl-ʾalbāb
english_saheeh_international: Hajj is during well-known months, so whoever has made Hajj obligatory upon himself therein by entering the state of ihram, there is to be for him no sexual relations and no disobedience and no disputing during Hajj. And whatever good you do - Allah knows it. And take provisions, but indeed, the best provision is fear of Allah. And fear Me, O you of understanding

arabic_uthmani: لَيسَ عَلَيكُم جُناحٌ أَن تَبتَغوا فَضلًا مِن رَبِّكُم ۚ فَإِذا أَفَضتُم مِن عَرَفاتٍ فَاذكُرُوا اللَّهَ عِندَ المَشعَرِ الحَرامِ ۖ وَاذكُروهُ كَما هَداكُم وَإِن كُنتُم مِن قَبلِهِ لَمِنَ الضّالّينَ
blank: lays ʿalaykum junāḥ ʾ tabtaghū faḍlam-m rabbikum f-ʾidhā ʾafaḍtum m ʿarafāt f-dhkurū llāh ʿindal-mashʿaril-ḥarām w-dhkurūh k-mā hadākum w-ʾ kuntum m qablihī l-min ḍ-ḍāllīn
english_saheeh_international: There is no blame upon you for seeking bounty from your Lord during Hajj. But when you depart from 'Arafat, remember Allah at al- Mash'ar al-Haram. And remember Him, as He has guided you, for indeed, you were before that among those astray

arabic_uthmani: ثُمَّ أَفيضوا مِن حَيثُ أَفاضَ النّاسُ وَاستَغفِرُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفورٌ رَحيمٌ
blank: thumm ʾafīḍū m ḥayth ʾafāḍ n-nās w-staghfirū llāh ʾinn llāh ghafūr raḥīm
english_saheeh_international: Then depart from the place from where all the people depart and ask forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful

arabic_uthmani: فَإِذا قَضَيتُم مَناسِكَكُم فَاذكُرُوا اللَّهَ كَذِكرِكُم آباءَكُم أَو أَشَدَّ ذِكرًا ۗ فَمِنَ النّاسِ مَن يَقولُ رَبَّنا آتِنا فِي الدُّنيا وَما لَهُ فِي الآخِرَةِ مِن خَلاقٍ
blank: f-ʾidhā qaḍaytum manāsikakum f-dhkurū llāh k-dhikrikum ʾābāʾakum ʾaw ʾashadd dhikr f-min n-nās m yaqūl rabbanā ʾātinā fī d-dunyā w-mā lahū fīl-ʾākhirat m khalāq
english_saheeh_international: And when you have completed your rites, remember Allah like your previous remembrance of your fathers or with much greater remembrance. And among the people is he who says, "Our Lord, give us in this world," and he will have in the Hereafter no share

arabic_uthmani: وَمِنهُم مَن يَقولُ رَبَّنا آتِنا فِي الدُّنيا حَسَنَةً وَفِي الآخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وَقِنا عَذابَ النّارِ
blank: w-minhum m yaqūl rabbanā ʾātinā fī d-dunyā ḥasanat w-fīl-ʾākhirat ḥasanat w-qinā ʿadhāb n-nār
english_saheeh_international: But among them is he who says, "Our Lord, give us in this world that which is good and in the Hereafter that which is good and protect us from the punishment of the Fire

arabic_uthmani: أُولٰئِكَ لَهُم نَصيبٌ مِمّا كَسَبوا ۚ وَاللَّهُ سَريعُ الحِسابِ
blank: ʾulāʾik lahum naṣīb mimmā kasabū w-llāh sarīʿul-ḥisāb
english_saheeh_international: Those will have a share of what they have earned, and Allah is swift in account

arabic_uthmani: ۞ وَاذكُرُوا اللَّهَ في أَيّامٍ مَعدوداتٍ ۚ فَمَن تَعَجَّلَ في يَومَينِ فَلا إِثمَ عَلَيهِ وَمَن تَأَخَّرَ فَلا إِثمَ عَلَيهِ ۚ لِمَنِ اتَّقىٰ ۗ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَاعلَموا أَنَّكُم إِلَيهِ تُحشَرونَ
blank: w-dhkurū llāh fī ʾayyām maʿdūdāt f-m taʿajjal fī yawmayn f-lā ʾithm ʿalayh w-m taʾakhkhar f-lā ʾithm ʿalayh l-man ttaqā w-ttaqū llāh w-ʿlamū ʾannakum ʾilayh tuḥsharūn
english_saheeh_international: And remember Allah during specific numbered days. Then whoever hastens his departure in two days - there is no sin upon him; and whoever delays until the third - there is no sin upon him - for him who fears Allah. And fear Allah and know that unto Him you will be gathered

blank: w-min n-nās m yuʿjibuk qawluhū fīl-ḥayāt d-dunyā w-yushhid llāh ʿalā mā fī qalbihī w-huw ʾaladdul-khiṣām
english_saheeh_international: And of the people is he whose speech pleases you in worldly life, and he calls Allah to witness as to what is in his heart, yet he is the fiercest of opponents

blank: w-ʾidhā tawallā saʿā fīl-ʾarḍ l-yufsid fīhā w-yuhlikal-ḥarth w-n-nasl w-llāh lā yuḥibbul-fasād
english_saheeh_international: And when he goes away, he strives throughout the land to cause corruption therein and destroy crops and animals. And Allah does not like corruption

arabic_uthmani: وَإِذا قيلَ لَهُ اتَّقِ اللَّهَ أَخَذَتهُ العِزَّةُ بِالإِثمِ ۚ فَحَسبُهُ جَهَنَّمُ ۚ وَلَبِئسَ المِهادُ
blank: w-ʾidhā qīl lah ttaq llāh ʾakhadhathul-ʿizzat b-l-ʾithm f-ḥasbuhū jahannam w-l-biʾsal-mihād
english_saheeh_international: And when it is said to him, "Fear Allah," pride in the sin takes hold of him. Sufficient for him is Hellfire, and how wretched is the resting place

arabic_uthmani: وَمِنَ النّاسِ مَن يَشري نَفسَهُ ابتِغاءَ مَرضاتِ اللَّهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ رَءوفٌ بِالعِبادِ
blank: w-min n-nās m yashrī nafsah btighāʾ marḍāt llāh w-llāh raʾūf b-l-ʿibād
english_saheeh_international: And of the people is he who sells himself, seeking means to the approval of Allah. And Allah is kind to His servants

arabic_uthmani: يا أَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنُوا ادخُلوا فِي السِّلمِ كافَّةً وَلا تَتَّبِعوا خُطُواتِ الشَّيطانِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لَكُم عَدُوٌّ مُبينٌ
blank: yā-ʾayyuhālladhīn ʾāmanū dkhulū fī s-silm kāffat w-lā tattabiʿū khuṭuwāt sh-shayṭān ʾinnahū lakum ʿaduww mubīn
english_saheeh_international: O you who have believed, enter into Islam completely and perfectly and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy

arabic_uthmani: فَإِن زَلَلتُم مِن بَعدِ ما جاءَتكُمُ البَيِّناتُ فَاعلَموا أَنَّ اللَّهَ عَزيزٌ حَكيمٌ
blank: f-ʾ zalaltum m baʿd mā jāʾatkumul-bayyināt f-ʿlamū ʾann llāh ʿazīz ḥakīm
english_saheeh_international: But if you deviate after clear proofs have come to you, then know that Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise

arabic_uthmani: هَل يَنظُرونَ إِلّا أَن يَأتِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ في ظُلَلٍ مِنَ الغَمامِ وَالمَلائِكَةُ وَقُضِيَ الأَمرُ ۚ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ تُرجَعُ الأُمورُ

english_saheeh_international: Do they await but that Allah should come to them in covers of clouds and the angels as well and the matter is then decided? And to Allah all matters are returned

arabic_uthmani: سَل بَني إِسرائيلَ كَم آتَيناهُم مِن آيَةٍ بَيِّنَةٍ ۗ وَمَن يُبَدِّل نِعمَةَ اللَّهِ مِن بَعدِ ما جاءَتهُ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ شَديدُ العِقابِ
blank: sal banī ʾisrāʾīl kam ʾātaynāhum m ʾāyat bayyinat w-m yubaddil niʿmat llāh m baʿd mā jāʾath f-ʾinn llāh shadīdul-ʿiqāb
english_saheeh_international: Ask the Children of Israel how many a sign of evidence We have given them. And whoever exchanges the favor of Allah for disbelief after it has come to him - then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty

arabic_uthmani: زُيِّنَ لِلَّذينَ كَفَرُوا الحَياةُ الدُّنيا وَيَسخَرونَ مِنَ الَّذينَ آمَنوا ۘ وَالَّذينَ اتَّقَوا فَوقَهُم يَومَ القِيامَةِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَرزُقُ مَن يَشاءُ بِغَيرِ حِسابٍ
blank: zuyyin l-lladhīn kafarūl-ḥayāt d-dunyā w-yaskharūn minalladhīn ʾāmanū w-lladhīn ttaqaw fawqahum yawmal-qiyāmat w-llāh yarzuq m yashāʾ b-ghayr ḥisāb
english_saheeh_international: Beautified for those who disbelieve is the life of this world, and they ridicule those who believe. But those who fear Allah are above them on the Day of Resurrection. And Allah gives provision to whom He wills without account

arabic_uthmani: كانَ النّاسُ أُمَّةً واحِدَةً فَبَعَثَ اللَّهُ النَّبِيّينَ مُبَشِّرينَ وَمُنذِرينَ وَأَنزَلَ مَعَهُمُ الكِتابَ بِالحَقِّ لِيَحكُمَ بَينَ النّاسِ فيمَا اختَلَفوا فيهِ ۚ وَمَا اختَلَفَ فيهِ إِلَّا الَّذينَ أوتوهُ مِن بَعدِ ما جاءَتهُمُ البَيِّناتُ بَغيًا بَينَهُم ۖ فَهَدَى اللَّهُ الَّذينَ آمَنوا لِمَا اختَلَفوا فيهِ مِنَ الحَقِّ بِإِذنِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَهدي مَن يَشاءُ إِلىٰ صِراطٍ مُستَقيمٍ
blank: kān n-nās ʾummat wāḥidat f-baʿath llāh n-nabiyyīn mubashshirīn w-mundhirīn w-ʾanzal maʿahumul-kitāb b-l-ḥaqq l-yaḥkum bayn n-nās fī-mā khtalafū fīh w-mā khtalaf fīh ʾillālladhīn ʾūtūh m baʿd mā jāʾathumul-bayyināt baghy baynahum f-hadā llāhulladhīn ʾāmanū l-mā khtalafū fīh minal-ḥaqq b-ʾidhnihī w-llāh yahdī m yashāʾ ʾilā ṣirāṭ mustaqīm
english_saheeh_international: Mankind was of one religion before their deviation; then Allah sent the prophets as bringers of good tidings and warners and sent down with them the Scripture in truth to judge between the people concerning that in which they differed. And none differed over the Scripture except those who were given it - after the clear proofs came to them - out of jealous animosity among themselves. And Allah guided those who believed to the truth concerning that over which they had differed, by His permission. And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path

arabic_uthmani: أَم حَسِبتُم أَن تَدخُلُوا الجَنَّةَ وَلَمّا يَأتِكُم مَثَلُ الَّذينَ خَلَوا مِن قَبلِكُم ۖ مَسَّتهُمُ البَأساءُ وَالضَّرّاءُ وَزُلزِلوا حَتّىٰ يَقولَ الرَّسولُ وَالَّذينَ آمَنوا مَعَهُ مَتىٰ نَصرُ اللَّهِ ۗ أَلا إِنَّ نَصرَ اللَّهِ قَريبٌ
blank: ʾam ḥasibtum ʾ tadkhulūl-jannat w-lammā yaʾtikum mathalulladhīn khalaw m qablikum massathumul-baʾsāʾ w-ḍ-ḍarrāʾ w-zulzilū ḥattā yaqūl r-rasūl w-lladhīn ʾāmanū maʿahū matā naṣr llāh ʾ-lā ʾinn naṣr llāh qarīb
english_saheeh_international: Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while such trial has not yet come to you as came to those who passed on before you? They were touched by poverty and hardship and were shaken until even their messenger and those who believed with him said, "When is the help of Allah?" Unquestionably, the help of Allah is near

arabic_uthmani: يَسأَلونَكَ ماذا يُنفِقونَ ۖ قُل ما أَنفَقتُم مِن خَيرٍ فَلِلوالِدَينِ وَالأَقرَبينَ وَاليَتامىٰ وَالمَساكينِ وَابنِ السَّبيلِ ۗ وَما تَفعَلوا مِن خَيرٍ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ بِهِ عَليمٌ
blank: yasʾalūnak mādhā yunfiqūn qul mā ʾanfaqtum m khayr f-l-l-wālidayn w-l-ʾaqrabīn w-l-yatāmā w-l-masākīn w-bn s-sabīl w-mā tafʿalū m khayr f-ʾinn llāh bihī ʿalīm
english_saheeh_international: They ask you, O Muhammad, what they should spend. Say, "Whatever you spend of good is to be for parents and relatives and orphans and the needy and the traveler. And whatever you do of good - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it

arabic_uthmani: كُتِبَ عَلَيكُمُ القِتالُ وَهُوَ كُرهٌ لَكُم ۖ وَعَسىٰ أَن تَكرَهوا شَيئًا وَهُوَ خَيرٌ لَكُم ۖ وَعَسىٰ أَن تُحِبّوا شَيئًا وَهُوَ شَرٌّ لَكُم ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَعلَمُ وَأَنتُم لا تَعلَمونَ
blank: kutib ʿalaykumul-qitāl w-huw kurh lakum w-ʿasā ʾ takrahū shayʾ w-huw khayr lakum w-ʿasā ʾ tuḥibbū shayʾ w-huw sharr lakum w-llāh yaʿlam w-ʾantum lā taʿlamūn
english_saheeh_international: Fighting has been enjoined upon you while it is hateful to you. But perhaps you hate a thing and it is good for you; and perhaps you love a thing and it is bad for you. And Allah Knows, while you know not

arabic_uthmani: يَسأَلونَكَ عَنِ الشَّهرِ الحَرامِ قِتالٍ فيهِ ۖ قُل قِتالٌ فيهِ كَبيرٌ ۖ وَصَدٌّ عَن سَبيلِ اللَّهِ وَكُفرٌ بِهِ وَالمَسجِدِ الحَرامِ وَإِخراجُ أَهلِهِ مِنهُ أَكبَرُ عِندَ اللَّهِ ۚ وَالفِتنَةُ أَكبَرُ مِنَ القَتلِ ۗ وَلا يَزالونَ يُقاتِلونَكُم حَتّىٰ يَرُدّوكُم عَن دينِكُم إِنِ استَطاعوا ۚ وَمَن يَرتَدِد مِنكُم عَن دينِهِ فَيَمُت وَهُوَ كافِرٌ فَأُولٰئِكَ حَبِطَت أَعمالُهُم فِي الدُّنيا وَالآخِرَةِ ۖ وَأُولٰئِكَ أَصحابُ النّارِ ۖ هُم فيها خالِدونَ
